72826467.review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
[b]Deep Rock Galactic[/b] (DRG) is a class based Co-op and Solo first-person shooter with procedurally generated levels and an heavy emphasis on customization, set in a universe where Dwarves have colonized space far and wide. Orbiting the planet Hoxxes, you and your eventual companions will engage in a variety of missions deep under the earth, infested with countless numbers of hostile aliens. Shoot, blast and dig your way to success for glory, promotions and rich rewards.

🟩 [b]The Good Side[/b]
[list]
[*][b]Excellent gameplay design that promotes interaction between classes.[/b]
Although fully playable in solo, DRG truly shines when played with ideally four different classes in a single match. In such environment, the game design truly comes to its azimuth as the four classes interact, support and compensate each others' weak points. For example, Scouts can reach highly placed minerals with their hook, but will need an Engineer's platform to recover them safely in most cases. Furthermore, each class does have a specific function, a varied team will be able to face diverse problems better.

[*][b]Simple yet beautiful visuals with remarkable effects, environments.[/b]
Made with fully destructible voxels, each object is relatively simple in geometry, although this is compensated by very good light effects, quality particles and generally a remarkable complexity of environments, depending on the biome.

[*][b]Extensive class customization possibilities.[/b]
The four classes can be outfitted not only with countless cosmetics, but also with a large variety of weapon modifications which can in some cases change completely how a given weapon works. Same goes for accessories such as armor or class-specific tools. This allows making "builds" and sets for different mission types.

[*][b]Overall good variety of objectives, enemies, random event combinations.[/b]
Each mission is generated randomly, and can include one of eight biome types, each with its own environmental unique dangers (sandstorms, lava pits, radiation...). Diverse biomes can include unique variations of common enemies specific to itself, spawn optional objectives such as Machine Events, Graves or Cargo Containers, each awarding something different. Missions can have modifiers which influence you or the enemy in major ways (low gravity for example).

[*][b]Good weapon, gadget balance makes each tool meaningful in its own way.[/b]
Generally weapons and equipment are balanced well, save for a few really gimmicky ones, this vouches for a good diversity of approach without getting crippled for trying something new. A specific class setup can change its playstyle dramatically.

[*][b]Solid challenge level on higher difficulties, requires coordination to overcome.[/b]
Cooperation and knowledge of mechanics are paramount in overcoming the merciless Hazard 5 difficulty and Deep Dives. Even fully coordinated teams of veterans won't have an easy time at this level.
[/list]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2149790470

🟥 [b]The Bad Side[/b]
[list]
[*][b]Some content unlocks are time-gated without a good reason.[/b]
Each week, you will be able to unlock only a certain amount of Overclocks (special weapon upgrades) and Cosmetics. After that amount, you'll need to wait the weekly refresh which happens every 7 days. Players who want to dedicate more time to the game are penalized without reason.

[*][b]A few slight gameplay-related inconveniences.[/b]
Such as being unable to kick players who join your session after the main objective was completed, or being unable to tell your MULE (mineral carrier) to stand still while facing a horde, so it doesn't get in the way.

[*][b]Poor weapon variety.[/b]
Only two main and two secondary weapons per class. This is partially fixed by overclocks which modify weapon functioning in a major way, though the variety remains poor overall.
[/list]

[h3]Rating: Excellent[/h3]
[i]For the current tag of 30€, offering at least 125+ hours of content and amazing gameplay, I can recommend getting this game at full price.[/i]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1989090445]Click here for the complete Rating Chart[/url]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2168670816

[h1]In-Depth Breakdown[/h1]
🎮 [b]Gameplay Analysis[/b]
Gameplay is divided into Preparation, Exploration, Objectives and Combat. 

[b]Preparation[/b]
Is done at your space station, using a variety of terminals to equip yourself, accept assignments and modify your appearance. There also is a bar where you can drink beer for various hilarious effects, while some grant passive bonuses for the next mission. The station also includes a variety of minigames and silly things to do such as kicking barrels around. Each of your classes can be assigned three different sets for diverse occasions, and as you rise through Global and Class ranks you will unlock new weapons and upgrades.

[b]Exploration[/b]
Is performed on foot and by using a variety of tools unique to each class. Drillers will employ a powerful excavator to make tunnels, Scouts will use their hook to fly around, Gunners build ziplines to traverse gaps, and Engineers can shoot platforms to build bridges and walkways. Exploring each environment thoroughly is important to find all the required materials such as minerals or parts, to complete the mission objectives and call supplies.  

A handy terrain scanner allows to see a 3D map of the caves, while markers and waypoints can also be placed. Illumination is always a concern and flares are for that. Hordes of enemies will keep spawning so being also fast is key. Finding events and hidden loot is time consuming but rewarding.

[b]Objectives[/b]
Vary for each mission, and include a Primary target needed to call the Pod and evacuate, while also a secondary one for extra XP and credits. In an Extermination mission you will have to take down multiple Glyphid bosses, while in a Repair mission you need to fix some MULEs and an entire Pod to use to escape, while attacked on all sides. Assignments are global quests that usually require you to complete a series of regular missions, and award cosmetics, weapons or licenses depending on the type. Deep Dives are basically 3-in-1 missions with two Primary targets each and higher difficulty - but also special rewards.

[b]Combat[/b]
Plays out in FPS fashion and focuses on a variety of status effects, weakspots and positioning. Each enemy has certain weak points that if hit inflict massive damage, while also resistance or weakness to certain elements. Many weapons and enemies inflict status effects such as Stun, Burning, Frozen and so on - using such at your advantage while positioning well in the map is fundamental. 

Taking on a horde of 100 enemies in the open is not a good idea, kiting them in a narrow passage is. There is a good amount of strategizing, synergy between weapon effects to discover and employ. You can never truly die but get incapacitated, a companion can revive you in this case, with 10% HP unless specific perks are used. Deforming terrain to your advantage proves really useful to combat if the conditions are right. Stay together or die alone.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2168670789

[h2]Technical Breakdown[/h2]
[u]PC Specs: RTX2080Ti, Ryzen 3900X, 32GB RAM DDR4[/u]

[list]
[*][b]Critical Problems[/b]
None.

[*][b]Optimization[/b]
Excellent. resource usage is lower than expected considering the technical level.

[*][b]Performance[/b]
The game runs without issues in 1440p, 85hz.

[*][b]Bugs[/b]
No major bugs to report.

[*][b]Other Issues[/b]
None.
[/list]

72989308.review:
[h1][b]Приветствую тебя, храбрый и не очень трезвый дворф![/b][/h1]

Спустя 75 часов, проведенных в игре Deep Rock Galactic (DRG), я таки решился написать на нее обзор. Мое знакомство с игрой началось еще во времена закрытой бетки более двух лет назад. Тогда посчастливилось раздобыть ключик и немного побегать. Игра в то время не отличалась богатством контента, но и не могу сказать, что не зацепила вообще.

К сожалению, разработчики никакие плюшки бета-тестерам не выдали. Как итог - игра для меня пропала из поля зрения вплоть до релиза в мае 2020 года, когда я все-таки решил ее купить.

[h1][b]Сюжет и история[/b][/h1]

Сюжета в игре как такового нет. Да он ей по сути и не нужен. Существует крупная корпорация Deep Rock Galactic, которая специализируется на добыче полезных (и не очень) ископаемых с планеты Hoxxes IV. В качестве рабочей силы - отважные и непритязательные дворфы. И все бы ничего, если бы данная планета не была густо заселена самыми разными жуками, пауками и прочей нечестью, которые каждый спуск подопечных компании способны превратить в сущий ад.

[h1][b]Геймплей[/b][/h1]

Все новоиспеченные шахтеры-дворфы в первую очередь попадают на орбитальную станцию. Это отличное место не только для того, чтобы собраться с мыслями и снаряжением для нового похода, но и просто потусоваться с друзьями. Ах да, игра кооперативная. Соло-режим есть, но во всей красе Deep Rock Galactic раскрывается именно в кооперативе и полноценной командной работе. 

Какие же основные занятия на орбитальной станции? Побросать бочки в пусковую станцию или в бочкомете, выпить пива, потанцевать, выпить пива, упасть в обморок, проснуться в медблоке, выпить пива и так до бесконечности. Казалось бы, что такого в этих репитативных действиях? Но когда ты даже в сотый раз этим занимаешься с друзьями - это все равно весело :)

Но да ладно, оставим тусовки, мы серьезные дворфы, и нужно работать. В конце концов и пиво, и музыка, не бесплатные, а потому надо спускать в недра нашей планеты и добывать золото и другие ресурсы. Именно здесь и начинается основное веселье.

В игре есть 4 класса харизматичных дворфов - разведчик, стрелок, бурильщик, инженер. Каждый со своим уникальным набором снаряжения и возможностями, но при этом самодостаточный и способный пронести миссию в соло. Никто не запрещает взять на задание хоть 4 инженера, но наиболее интересным и разнообразным получается геймплей при сочетании всех четырех разных дворфов. По сути своей любую задачу (будь то необходимость выкопать ресурсы где-то под потолком или спуститься в какую-то непроглядную дыру) можно выполнить любым дворфом. Но при этом далеко не все из них будут делать это быстро и эффективно.

Миссии также отличаются по своим условиям: добыча определенного количество ресурсов, убийство крупных дредноутов, воровство яиц неведомого существа, поиск кристаллов. Плюс к этому добавляется пачка второстепенных заданий, модификаторы миссий, 5 уровней сложности, соревнования альянсов шахтеров. И самое главное - генератор случайных карт, который каждый раз подбрасывает совершенно уникальную карту в выбранном вами биоме. Никаких повторений. Даже спустя 70 часов игры я не могу припомнить, чтобы две пещеры были похожи друг на друга.

Из дополнительного хочется отметить наличие заданий (как уникальных, так и еженедельных), хорошую систему кастомизации внешнего облика и билдов с перками (все бесплатно, естественно), контент для высоких уровней в виде глубоких погружений и высоких уровней сложности, от которых будет знатно гореть.

[h1][b]Графика и анимация[/b][/h1]

Графика в DRG является далеко не основным, что может удержать в игре. Стилистика сведена к лоу-польным модельками с довольно простыми шейдерами. Никакого реализма. Но даже несмотря на такое упрощенное оформление, игре удается генерировать отличное и очень атмосферное окружение. Нередки те случаи, когда ты выходишь в очередное крупное помещение пещеры, бросаешь фонарик и на несколько секунд замираешь от того зрелища, что открывается перед тобой. Я так и не понял, в чем секрет такой мрачной атмосферности, но дизайнеры игры явно не зря едят свой хлеб :)

[h1][b]Музыка и звуки[/b][/h1]

В Deep Rock Galactic нет музыки, которую будешь слушать на репите за пределами игры. В большинстве случаев музыка триггерит на определенные события (будь то эвакуация или очередная волна жуков) и локации, что добавляет ощущения драйва и той самой атмосферы. Стилистика при этом тяготеет к какому-то синти-попу с ретровейвом. Одно точно могу сказать - даже спустя 70 часов не будет желание отключить музыку и включить свой плейлист.

Отдельно хочется отметить забавную озвучку реплик самих дворфов, а также звуки окружения. Последнее является в принципе неотъемлемой частью геймплея, так как в темных пещерах при отсутствии фонарей в большинстве случаев именно звуки станут главным ориентиром и возможностью понять обстановку.

[h1][b]Оптимизация, баги[/b][/h1]

На слабом ПК игру не тестировал, но на своей машине игру запускаю в 4к разрешении и на максимальных настройках с почти стабильными 60 кадрами. Иногда могут быть просадки до 45-50 в каких-то лютых замесах, но это не частое явление и в общем-то не мешает. 

Баги - вот это тут бывает :) То грузовой мул застрянет в текстурах, то какая-то анимация баганет, то еще что-то. Не то чтобы это сильно мешало, напротив, иногда генерирует забавные курьезы. Создается ощущение, что у игры проблемы с коллайдерами.

Игра регулярно обновляется, получает новый контент, что тоже не может не радовать. В целом один из примеров того, как нужно делать игры в раннем доступе и поддерживать их после релиза.

[h1][b]Итог[/b][/h1]

Для меня Deep Rock Galactic стала первой кооперативной игрой, которая смогла затянуть на более чем 30 часов. И бросать игру совсем не хочется. Если вы хотите хорошо отдохнуть с друзьями, вдоволь повеселиться, а также найти ламповое комьюнити - добро пожаловать, всем будем рады.

[h1][b]Rock and Stone, Brothers![/b][/h1]

73231778.review:
This class based game is about completing objectives, mine minerals and fighting off swarm while managing ammo. The same minerals are used for upgrading your weapons and equipment.

The combat is satisfying. Every class has its unique guns/equipment and different role assigned. And mining is fun on procedurally generated levels with 9 different biomes. More biomes are in development according to the road-map. Updates are regular without any micro-transactions or season pass bullshit. If you are into customizing your character with skins and paint-jobs then you can earn all of them in-game as a tertiary mission or buy them with your in-game money.

Oh, and don't forget to spam the "V" button whenever you join someone. ;)

我（工程师）、阿楠（枪手）、饭爷（钻机手）和马里奥（侦察兵）是岩与石公司第236期应届生。最初校招没有马里奥，他是阿楠内推进公司的，马里奥凭着矫健的身手与出色的采矿嗅觉，多次带领我们菜鸟小组冲出险境；饭爷是个硬朗的坦克，烧起虫子的效率比他踢罐子强多了；阿楠是全队输出核心，没有什么大虫子是机枪突不死的，如果有，那就再加一梭子。只有我，孱弱的工程师，每次外派任务都会倒下四五次，忘记补炮台子弹，榴弹痛击队友，泡沫位置差强人意——出差最积极的我反而绩效最低。看着医疗室的天花板从陌生到熟悉，我暗自下决心加强业务学习，提升个人操作水平。
如今饭爷出勤率太低，实习结束遥遥无期；马里奥另谋出路，对领导的指派也不上心；阿楠虽然很快地过了实习期也适用通过，但是因为身体原因动不动就请假。只有我，在队友缺席的情况下，一次次出生入死于霍克斯四星：霉菌沼泽染病，飞沙走廊吃土，放射禁区嗦铀，冰封岩层感冒，熔岩之心泡澡。从被矿螺战略放弃，再到无伤杀无畏。现在的我即将晋升成骨干核心，是优秀的岩与石的员工，是绩效的霸榜者，是阿比斯酒吧的话题。

[code]           Начну с того, что ни скриншоты, ни трейлеры не вызывали у меня ни малейшего интереса к покупке данной игры. Но на одной из предрелизных распродаж цена была настолько вкусной и была подкреплена таким  огромным количеством положительных отзывов, что я не мог не купить ее. И как же я был поглощен атмосферой этой игры и этими ворчащими гномами… 
       Игра начинается с первого нажатия кнопки “play”. Запустил игру, нажал играть и ты  в супер потрясающем хабе, где помимо стандартных процедур с кастомизацией и выбором миссий, можно бухнуть с товарищами разные сорта пива, потанцевать или попинать бочки в любом доступном тебе направлении! Графика не особо реалистичная, но  наполнена деталями и совместно со звуковым оформлением  втягивает игрока в свой мир с первых секунд игрового процесса.   Основное удовольствие игра приносит  именно командным   взаимодействием: совместным исследованием процедурно сгенерированного мира с множеством разнообразных биомов, совместным ведением боя  с роем из различных врагов или совместной эвакуации от этих же  самых таракашек. 73108045.review:
[h1]You can't go wrong with Dwarves in Space?[/h1]

Deep Rock Galactic is class-based 1-4 players FPS coop experience about space dwarves adventures in caves. You are dropped in procedurally generated levels, where you have simple tasks to do: mine resources, collect or repair objects and kill bosses. On your way will stand hordes of enemies and difficult to cross terrain, but you have your classes!

[h1]Classes[/h1]
DRG is class based coop shooter and it is where it really shines. Each of four classes is quite unique and offers slighty different experience and range of abilities, but it is so well balanced that you can complete each mission solo. Coop experience with friends and even strangers is much more fun - that's where those classes can do the most [b]together[/b].

[h1]Community[/h1]
It worth mentioning that Deep Rock galactic playerbase is one of the most friendly and cooperative I have met. Playing public games is fluind, seamless and simply fun. I was surprised how helpful other players can be. It almost feels like, all the toxic players missed this game - which is great.

[h1]Customization[/h1]
DRG has a lot of to offer. As you progress, you unlock various cosmetics, new weapons and weapon modules which let player tweak and tune not only visual aspect of his favourite dwarf. Really cool part is, that some of the skins can be found during missions.

[h1]Missions and gameplay[/h1]
There are couple of them. Mine, find and repair or kill a boss. There is side-quests (collect X, Y, Z) and mission modifiers that change a gameplay a bit. In my opinion that is the weakest part of Deep Rock Galactic at the moment - after first 10 hours of game, you get that feeling "Oh, I already done that few times, but in a different cave". Here is where DRG can be described as quality over quality - levels, lobby, classes are nicely done, but number of activicties in game are lacking and become repetetive. I'd love to see more advanced missions and content added to the game, so I can spend another 20 or even more hours playing and keep finding new things to do. Doing the same missions to level up characters and unlock cosmetics just isn't enough.
My other issue is leveling curve - because of feeling of repetitiveness getting my character to higher level to unlock The Dives - end game gamemode - doesn't feel rewarding enough.

[h1]Rock & Stone![/h1]
DRG is solid foundation for more. Art style, gameplay, humour and quality are here. All what it needs to keep me playing is much more content, missions and objectives. How about ability to mine those resources to build own bases, vehicles and structures? 

In the end it is hard to not recommend Deep Rock Galactic - game of great quality, fun (with friends and strangers) and gameplay - one of the best releases of this year, that needs more variety in things to do.

72894149.review:
So let me get this straight. Deep Rock Galactic (DRG) is a game where:

- You can get drunk before missions and then spend the entire mission seeing double and falling into chasms as your character staggers around
- The community are generally really nice and helpful, will often give you tips to help your play during missions and will ask nicely if they need something from you
- You'll enjoy a range of beautiful, procedurally generated biomes with different hazards and structures for each one
- Gunplay feels super slick and solid, every gun has a substantial feeling to it and all the animations and handling are really nicely done. For instance, if you tap 'reload' when you're full then your dwarf playfully spins the gun in the air, which is such a cool way to make me forget I tried to reload a full gun by accident
- There's an upgrade system that's super simple and lets you tailor your dwarves to how you like to play
- There're fun customisation options for your dwarves that don't feel overwhelming
- The community are more than happy to have a drink and a dance at the bar after missions
- The bar serves "craft" beers with weird effects like setting you on fire and teleporting you around the station
- You never really feel short of the in game crafting materials and credits to get the upgrades and cosmetics you want. And even if you are you can either use the mineral exchange or just run like one more mission to get what you need, and that's fun all by itself

What more do you want? I [i]adore[/i] Deep Rock Galactic and I dumped something like 60 hours into it in my first week of owning it. It's so quintessentially cute and fun to play that it's easy entertainment whether with friends or getting matched up with randomers. Left 4 Dead style gameplay brought back in the best possible way.

Arguably, you might get a little tired of the gameplay after a point. There're only five mission types and the secondary objectives don't meaningfully alter the main mission feel. The procedural generation of caverns is cool, but after you've played each biome five times then you'll get the gist of how they look and what to expect. I think this is easy to look past if you really enjoy the gameplay and have something to play for, however, that "something to play for" is, unfortunately, DRG's biggest failing.

[h1]The End Game Problem[/h1]

Deep Rock Galactic's one significant con is that the end game content is [i]woefully[/i] poor and leaves you very little reason to keep playing.

End game plausibly starts after you've unlocked the vast majority of each dwarf's basic weapon upgrades, which is around 60 hours depending on how many dwarves you do, so you could argue you've already got good value for money out of the game either way. However, if you want to play on then there's actually not much else left to do in the game.

The main thrust of end game content is collecting overclocks, which are either special weapon or cosmetic upgrades. You acquire these (largely at random) on a weekly basis where you can obtain a limited number each week and have to wait for the following week to get some more.

Now, to be clear, overclocks in general are cool, although I'm not going to touch on the cosmetic ones because they're nice but not essential to gameplay. Weapon overlocks, on the other hand, are funky special upgrades that work like the basic upgrades but with more oomph, so you'll definitely want to get them and I think they're really nicely designed. Many offer interesting trade-offs that boost one part of a weapon at the expense of another (e.g. higher damage but for a smaller ammo clip) and you can use them to really capstone your preferred style of play. There're also some that offer smaller boosts with no drawbacks if you don't like any of the cons to the more powerful ones.

However, as mentioned, you're only given two random weapon overclocks a week (assuming you do the weekly assignment and the regular deep dive), plus two blank cores you can choose to make into semi-random weapon overclocks (you can pick from two dwarves when converting the core but the overclock you get will be a random one for any of that dwarf's weapons). So a decent amount of the overclocks you'll get will likely be for a dwarf you use less, or on a weapon you don't like and you only get a handful of chances a week to get something you want. At this point it's important to stress that [b]you never get a duplicate overclock[/b] so you [i]will[/i] get all the overclocks eventually, which is a really nice thing, but it's still frustrating if you don't get any overclocks for your favourite dwarf/weapon for a while.

Now, if you're like me and you play several dwarves then you probably won't mind the random aspect of overclock rewards as you simply make do with what you get until you get something you really want. However, my [i]real[/i] gripe with this system is that there's very little reason to play the game outside of when the new week begins and overclock rewards reset. There's no other way of getting new overclocks and there's no new content at end game other than continuing to level your dwarves to get a fancier portrait border (which is a huge grind anyway).

In short, the issue is thus: I want to actually have a reason to be playing. Maybe if you got one overclock every 15 missions or something I would know I was at least working towards [i]something[/i], but right now there's nothing and it doesn't sound like there're any plans to expand end game at the moment.

DRG regulars will tell me that Deep Dive missions are technically also end game content, but all a Deep Dive is is a series of three fundamentally regular missions strung together back to back. You can't even encounter special events or gather crafting resources during them, it's all just about how fast you do them, and even that's just for posterity. Maybe if you have a group of friends and you want to do the elite Deep Dive together (as opposed to the non-elite one) to see how fast a time you can get vs the difficulty then you might get some value from the idea, however you have to wait a week for a new set of Deep Dives to generate, so there's still nothing else to do after you've done it once. Overall, compared to standard missions, Deep Dives are just sadly lacklustre as an experience compared to the regular missions.

To conclude, end game is an mess in DRG at the moment. The overclocks are great, but they come in really slowly and there's nothing else to play for in the mean time. Like, I absolutely love this game and would happily grind my way through a bunch of missions just knowing I was getting even a little bit closer to unlocking my next overclock... But there's just nothing. There aren't even any cool boss raids or anything. The developers have poured all their time into making the regular missions fun, but I just think there're so many end game content ideas that DRG could expand into that just don't exist at the moment. Who knows. The game's still being developed, though at time of writing I believe it'll be new mission types and biomes next, which, to be fair, will be really good, but I think it's a band-aid for the real issue.

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]

To finish, the game's fantastic and you don't need a friend to experience 98% of the content, but you'll stop having a reason to play after 60 hours or so. 60 hours is a long time so maybe that's good enough, but if you finish levelling up your dwarves and can't wait for what's next then you might be a bit disappointed.

Стрелок попытался кинуть свой SHIT на инжа, но, не рассчитав траекторию полёта этой многополигональной серой шайбы, SHIT угодил в очень глубокий овраг, на дне которого находились три шараплюя. Deep Rock Galactic is an excellent cooperative mining game.
Even while it was in early access, the developers did an amazing job at updating the game, and even reworking entire sections to improve the gameplay.

Procedural levels means there's a lot of replayability, and having to find your way around really makes it feel like you're exploring the unknown. Some classes have a harder time navigating certain biomes, but if you play as a team you can make up for each other's weaknesses.

I can't speak to the single-player aspect of the game, as I didn't play much of it at all. As a cooperative experience, it is one of the best. Goofing off is one of the best things in the game, and the design even encourages it.

I don't have anything negative to say about DRG other than the performance could be better and more consistent on my older graphics card. Visually it looks great even on the lowest settings.

The developers have gone a great job, and really know how to focus on making a great experience with good design decisions.

This game is some of the best fun I've had in a long time. I enjoyed it so much that I bought all of the DLC just to support the devs.

The game is well-polished. The voice acting is hilarious (and high quality). The environments are procedurally generated with a good balance of navigability and challenge. The player classes interact well together while still being highly customizable. The ping system is useful enough that you rarely need to use voice/text chat.

I definitely recommend playing with friends, though it has a non-toxic community that makes playing with randoms worthwhile too. Single player is manageable, but not as rewarding as multiplayer.

[b]Bottom Line:[/b] I consider this a top-tier team PvE game, worth its full price. If you want to play solo, look for it on sale.

73199563.review:
I could say Deep Rock Galactic is a rock-solid game and immediately get marked for execution by the Pun Police. So I won't do that. Instead, I'll say DRG is a fun as hell co-op shooter, and a game that scratches one of the most primal urges a human can have: [i]diggy diggy hole.[/i]

[h1]Overview[/h1]

You are dwarven employee for Deep Rock Galactic, the only company still around the broken deathtrap world of Hoxxes IV. There are four of you: a gunner, a driller, an engineer, and a scout. Together, you brave the dark wilds of the underneath, which mostly means mining minerals and shooting bugs into giblets.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

DRG is a first-person shooter, with emphasis on resource collecting and cooperation. Unlike, say, Left 4 Dead where the objective is to simply reach the end, DRG deposits you and your squad in a randomly-generated cave with a couple of objectives to fill, and from then on out you're given full leeway on how to approach the problem based on your squad composition.

This is where the game truly shines; while the gunplay is great and the guns have the right kind of impact, it also revolves around using your dwarves based on their class. Scouts are mobile, drillers can set everything on fire, engineers solve practical problems, and the gunner guns. 

Every mission is different. Every mission has its own roadblocks, and its own ways it can go south in an instant. While patterns [i]emerge[/i] after a while of playing, I've yet to have a mission that felt [i]routine[/i], because going in with that mentality is a very good way to get a squad wipe.

DRG scratches two main itches, one of which I mentioned at the start. First, it's just a very good FPS in general, but secondly, there's something just [i]satisfying[/i] about digging out your objectives with a pickaxe. It satisfies the exact same part of your brain that digging in Minecraft does, except now you have high explosives.

[h1]Gameplay loop[/h1]

Another thing that I appreciate about this game is that there's always something to come back to, at least for a long time. Once you promote a single dwarf once, you begin to be able to unlock powerful overclocks. Those cost minerals, and not a trivial amount. But doing missions to get those minerals to make the overclocks also nets you XP, and eventually promotions, which also cost resources. Your work is never quite done, but in a way that makes it feel natural. I'd compare this to maybe something a little less graceful like Warframe, where there might be a few too [i]many[/i] resources to keep track of, and the sheer volume just becomes overwhelming. Here, your dwarven beards and armor feel like they need just the right amount of effort to unlock.

[h1]Summary[/h1]

I mean, the game's been out five months, and in that time I've put in north of 150 hours. It's been [i]well[/i] worth the price, and I'd recommend it to anyone that likes a nice multiplayer FPS.

I tend to be hypercritical of games. Even in games I like overall, there are plenty of moments that make me question what the hell the devs were thinking, or just find a lot of glitches that make it look like a shoddy mess of a game.

Yet this relatively small indie team has put together a game that, for over 20 hours, has had me *constantly* thinking "wow, that is REALLY well-designed" about every thing I see. There are so many small choices that you can tell are deliberate, and they all point to an extremely competent group of developers, both in their design and their programming. Small things that really add up and give hypercritical armchair developers like myself a constant sense of awe.

Things like the resupply kits blinking if someone's using them -- it's a nifty and unintrusive way of letting your teammates know you're using the resupply. Things like the escape shuttle -- there's an alternate reality where you just hit a button on the MULE and go home. But here it's a (honestly pretty low-risk and easy but action-packed) sequence to cap off every mission. Things like how the Engineer's turret is a frisby that actually flies and paths from spot to spot instead of you needing to pick it up directly. The intricate armor and weak spot system that is flawlessly communicated through the visual design. The care put into the ship when any other game would just have a UI lobby system.

Just so many small things that show this game is made by a competent group that sincerely want it to be as good as it can be. And it shows. And it's a damn good game.

73707079.review:
Mission based cooperative multiplayer that goes a long way maintain both a sense of structure and persistence. Solid procedural map generation keeps run after run fresh, interesting, and dynamic. Charming tone, coupled with a rewarding (if largely optional) challenge. 

Easy to coordinate: little/no coordination required. Easy to play: difficult to master. From individual play, to the cooperative play, DRG doesn't demand much up front, but facilitates and rewards mastery of all it's elements.

I'm not big on pubs, but DRG is in an exclusive class of multiplayer games where it is not only pretty fun to play with strangers, but realistic to communicate and cooperate with each other; no voice chat required. At present that category is populated solely by Deep Rock.

If you like charming light hearted games that you can play at your own pace and still generally progress, (success or failure), you won't go wrong with DRG.
If you like challenging yourself to push farther and dig deeper, you won't go wrong with DRG.
If you like playing with friends versus CPU, you won't go wrong with DRG.
If you enjoy rapid-fire game genres where you can play a match within two minutes before moving on to something else... you could maybe go wrong with DRG.

Game is best multiplayer, but if you're stubbornly insistent on stranger danger, DRG is serviceable solo, if you're big on digging and exploration. The procedural caves are well done.

Con: Could stand for literally any other cheer/call out beyond "rock & stone". "Ice&Snow" when, Ghostship Games? You already have a frozen biome. I am very disappointed...

72847953.review: There are lots and lots of multiplayer games out there, but few do the same as Deep Rock Galactic. The 4 Classes and tense game-play make exploring a dangerous cave with your friends fun and thrilling. The game with it's class based setup is a lot more fun with a party of friends. But there is nothing quite like holding off a horde of Glyphids holed up in a cave with your pals. If you and your friends like having fun misadventures in games, you should definitely look into getting this game.

73950518.review:
This is a really funny game, it's filled with hilarious humour; you can do extremely funny dances in the bar, like the floss dance, gangnam style, riverdance, etc, and drink beers that have funny and strange symptoms :D There are four classes of dwarves you can be, each with their own unique abilities and weapons:

The gunner - The most powerful and best for killing, his huge machine gun easily mows bugs down. He can also fire ziplines across chasms, handy if you see something you want to mine, but there's a gap between you. And he has a pistol, which is best for close range, but I'm not crazy about this weapon, because it's very slow at reloading. 

The driller  - all the dwarves have pickaxes to mine precious minerals and through walls, but the driller has contraptions on his hands that allow him to drill through walls - much faster than any of the other dwarves can do with their pickaxes. He also has a pickaxe, but drilling is much faster way of going through walls, and covers a much larger area when digging. I wouldn't recommend using these drills when mining right at precious minerals (better to use the pickaxe for that, because the driller has one, just like the other dwarves), but it's useful for mining a path towards them. The driller also has a deadly flamethrower that can incinerate multiple bugs, handy if you're overwhelmed with bugs. And he also has a pistol, which I really love, because it can be fired and reloaded rapidly :D

The engineer - this dwarf has a lot of abilities - he can fire platforms onto any surface. Very handy if you see precious minerals high up above you in the cave wall, but there's nothing there to stand on beneath you to mine it; he can also fire the platforms on the ground to cover up holes in the ground, especially if the ground contains burning hot molten rock. These platforms also act like a bit of a trampoline - if you fall directly onto them, it reduces fall damage; good for getting down from places quickly. The engineer can also build a stationary automatic gun turret (2 at a time, when you reach a higher level), which fires at bugs that come too close to it. Useful if a swarm of bugs is coming at you when you're busy mining or doing something else at the moment; the turret can kill the bugs while you focus on that. Every now and then, the turret has to be manually reloaded, but it's fast to do, so isn't really a problem. The engineer's weapons pack a big punch, one being much like a big shotgun, and the other exploding multiple enemies in one hit, because...it's a grenade launcher :D And this is a very funny one - he can throw grenades that distract enemies, causing them to attack it instead of you: throw the grenade, and a hologram of a dancing dwarf will pop up; the dancing (the same kind of dances that you can do at the bar) is picked at random with each grenade. The hologram starts as a green colour, then turns from yellow to orange to red as it gets used up.

And the scout - the scout, my personal favourite :) By far the easiest dwarf, and, in my opinion, the most enjoyable, to use in the game, because: 
1. He has an incredibly handy flare gun; you can fire flares up onto the cave walls or ceiling above, lighting areas up much more brighter and effectively than any of the other dwarves, who are only able to throw little flares onto the ground, which only burn for a couple seconds, and cover a very tiny area; the scout can also throw these little flares on the ground, but the flares from his flare gun burn for much longer, and cover a huge area, with each individual flare. Extremely useful in this game, because just about all the caves in this game are gigantic, and having those flares be up high on the cave walls and ceiling help you to spot precious minerals very easily that are high up, or in hard-to-reach places. 
2. He has a grappling hook, which you can fire at walls or ceilings above, to be hoisted up to areas quickly. Makes it easier to fight enemies too, cause you can use the grappling hook to swing out of safety quickly. The grappling hook, other than the flare gun, is one of the scout's best features, cause you can use it as a shortcut to reach areas; the other dwarves don't have this luxury, they have to do it by digging their way there with the pickaxe. 
At first, the scout's weapons are a shotgun (not a fan of this one at all, because the reloading is incredibly slow), and an automatic rifle, which has very good range; but, when you reach a higher level, it gets much more interesting - you can get a sniper-like rifle, which can kill enemies in one or 2 hits from a very long distance, and, my favourite, 2 twin repeater guns, which fire rapidly like little machine guns, mowing enemies down quickly. They don't deal heavy damage like the gunner's machine gun, but they still deal enough damage to wipe enemies out very quickly, especially when they've been upgraded to deal maximum damage. 

So, that's a summary of each class of dwarf in this game, try out each class, and see which one works best for you! :) 

However, one thing I really don't like about this game, though, with great emphasis, is the profanity - there is an unnecessary amount of swearing in this game. I know these are dwarves, and they can be rough around the edges, but the swearing in this game is not necessary, and inappropriate. For instance, when you kill enemies, your dwarf can suddenly shout (I refuse to type the actual words in this review, hence, why I typed the stars instead) "That's all you've got, you slippery little "****?!" or "You ugly son of a *****!" Every time I hear the dwarves say this, it makes me cringe, and it would be nice if this game could be updated, where the swearing could be removed, or at least for an option to be made available that silences the swearing, or something like that. Because, this game, other than that, is good, the swearing is absolutely unnecessary, though, and taints the experience.

Other than that, this a funny game, and fun to play multiplayer, especially fun to rock it out in the bar with friends, whether it's drinking the beers together and seeing the funny results, dancing, or both combined :D

But, I would not recommend this game for kids at all, due to the profanity in this game.

I'd rank this game a 6/10. its got some fun elements to it, but most of it is encompassed within "playin with friends", which i'm alright with but it will never be more than a 6.
PROS:  
-when u have a team, the classes seem very complimentary and supportive of each other.
-the shooting and movement mechanics seem smooth in relation to the faster paced enemies that come at you.
-the weapons for each class seem balanced and different enough to allow for variation in play style and don't have the problem of 'everyone always plays scout' or one class cuz all the rest just can't compete.
-the beers and thier effects. nuff said.
-commentary, dialogue and music in the game are solid.
-forces players to be aware of multiple things and collaborate with others. 
  -check the map to see where your tunneling or going (oh god i mined out my floor!)
  - look around you as your moving don't juggernaut out; 4 pairs of eyes are better than one
  - make a plan; the hordes comin. "billy watch my back I'm mining this, then we gotta get outa here!"
  - randomized overclocks. yup. thats good stuff in your guys game. very well done.

CONS:
-on defense missions why do detonators spawn 2 ft around the corner from you? its just ends the match which is more frustrating than it is fun (its not even skill building or team work encouraging due to the fact that it spawns with in attacking radius. we hear the sound and then boom! theres no time to react. thats garbage.) it would be fine if the hordes didn't force 'every1 to stand together or die alone' tactic, but due to these detonations, happening all to often, on def missions, just adds to other issues like the unfortunate rogue-like nature of the map. which i cover below.
-The fact some classes are just bound to fail or preform very pourly on certain map types can also be frustrating due to the lack of versatility in your character for traversing some of these cave systems. eg. maps that are just 300m deep pits where your missions at the bottom; oh crap are you the gunner? well abort that mission or make sure you have a friend. This is another issue that would be fine if there was versatility in your character that allowed for that, such as more skill tree upgrades or options  or upgrades for your flares, like sticky flares or a hover skill that didn't call the MULE instead. (i also understand that I've just started to do deep dives, so maybe i haven't gotten all the potential upgrades, but the struggle to get here could have been buffered more with allowance to more versatility and abilities.
-Bosco for solo mode is just useless and so dumb. half the time for combat he's just MIA and when he finally does show up he's in the way. his weapons are way to weak for how the bots awareness level and sadly the MULE is dumber than a donkey. i seriously doubt, from my understanding of dwarves from fiction or fantasy, would engineer robots to be as useless as these 2. sercioulsy devs. MAKE BETTER AI. the MULE does the same stuff as bosco, but that thing doesnt have guns. It could just be my luck, but that mule seems to show up more with the horde to help fight than bosco does. in fact for a robot that you use to deposit your recourses it seems to be halfway across the planet when you finally find those veins and are ready to deposit only again to show up with the horde and the sad thing is, is i call the mule before i start smashing veins. why does it seem the mule only follows me when the hordes here. it just blocks my bullets! why would dwarves build a gunless robot that holds your hand through out the horde. im sure they wood have a way to tell the mule, "get over there out of my way!" and "bosco! watch my back u useless robot, atleast you could startshouting things b4 they hit me so atleast i could react to enemies with feather footsteps. lie i get it, you start smakcking the walls inhabited by creatures with hieghtened hearing, they are gonna come for ya. but y can't the robots just do something usefull. Bosco's rockets are actually nerf darts (not gonna talk about his bullets) and his ability to mine veins is very... well go back three times bosco, cuz how do you miss all that? and his enhanced light is still like a old flash light with dying batteries and the bots awareness level is depressing. he shoots w/e u do and only sees enemies coming if they are hitting you. The mule always showing up during combat or hordes is frustrating enough even when playing with friends, trying to fly solo with such a useless garbage trucks. like wow no. imonna play something else. like why would program AI thats worse that claptrap. Ive seen better AI's in NES games. I dont want a robot that i cant pass the game with and not do anything cuz boscos just that OP, but can he be alittle more usefull than him not being there. atleast if the hovering dump truck, wasnt there i would start doing things like mining part of the vein b4 i would check my back, but i assume boscos right behind me  in a 1 way tunnel, so he should atleast start shooting things b4 they get to me right? nope mini-detonators will blow up b4 bosco even decides to start shooting...  his dmg is fine if he would actually start shooting things b4 they hit you or it had some command tactics you could assign to him ("Bosco, back to back. bosco scout this path. bosco help me mine a path up to that level")

Would I recommend this game? yes if you have friends to play this with. if not then NO. My friends and I, don't always work the same shifts of have the same time off, so we usually get together and game when we can and if we want to further our progression in the game so, we can have more fun when we get together again, that's cool. you can solo some other missions maybe not the extra brutal ones. this game you can't really do that, and through-out my time playing so far I've noticed this isn't a very friendly solo game. and so for that 6/10. balance your game better, with options of versatility, to encourage more player skills and problem solving, not abort the mission cuz this is actaully impossible for us (driller/scout combo). having 5 ziplines on the gunner to get to the bottom of 3-300m pits. Not enough nitrate in this map for that. too many missions fall short due to limited character skills and versatily. Just sayin no dwarf wood suck so much at mining when thats what thier entire life was about. They'de have better tools and skills for when it came to travesing the caves systems they are trying to mine. for as tough as you devs make to dwarves out to be, they suck. they are fairies. the only thing about them that says mining is they have pickaxes.. thats pretty much it. bunch of short alcoholics in space.

69064092.review:
Вот и пришел релиз, а значит пора сделать обзор с точки зрения «ветерана» Deep Rock Galactic.

Иногда у новичков происходит путаница о концепте игры. Нет, это не майнкрафт с пушками в космосе, это скорее Left 4 dead в пещерах в космосе. Концепт геймплея можно описать так: вы отправляетесь в случайно сгенерированную пещеру-уровень, где должны сделать выданную вам задачу и успешно эвакуироваться обратно на станцию. Сам геймплей делится на 2 большие составляющие: пазловая часть и шутерная часть.

Пазловая часть —  это все то, чем вы будете заниматься в моменты тишины. Перемещаться под землей в одиночку сложно и опасно, а поэтому у каждого класса есть уникальный набор инструментов, чтобы ускорить пересечение местности. Чем быстрее вы добудете все необходимые минералы, тем ниже шанс того, что вы станете кормом для жуков. Шутерная же часть начинается в тот же момент, когда вы услышите крик десятков жуков и грозный топот жуков побольше. Самым частым противником для вас будет обычный глифид-воин, и если на сложностях пониже они не выглядят грозными, то на высоких сложностях непрерывный поток паукообразных станет для вас главной причиной, почему вам нельзя прекращать стрелять.

Атмосфера игры – сильнейшая часть игры. Узкие тоннели, где вас могут заставь врасплох, и гигантские пещеры, на фоне которых вы сами как муравей, идеально дополняются подходящим саундтреком. Чувство темноты и изоляции всегда будут идти рядом с вами.

Поподробнее поговорим о классах: в игре 4 класса, между которыми можно переключаться в любой момент. В отличие от многих кооп игр, в DRG нет выраженных «керри» и «саппорт» классов, каждый обладает тем, чего нет у других. Если у вас не хватает любого из 4 классов, вы всегда будете ощущать его отсутствие, а в мыслях будет проносится: «А вот был бы у нас бурильщик!». 

Бурильщик – главный поставщик урона по области в команде, обладающий огнеметом и взрывпакетами, но имееющий серьезные проблемы с убийством крупных и/или далеких целей. Для преодоления пещер снабжен бурами, которыми можно ровнять ландшафт, проделывать лестницы в породе как вверх, так и вниз, пробуривать прямые ходы из одной секции пещеры в другую, игнорируя природные тоннели.

Стрелок – главный поставщик всего урона в команде. В бою не имеет минусов: огромный урон сочетается с самым наибольшим боезапасом среди всех классов. В случае опасности обладает щитом, под куполом которого вы и ваши союзники практически неуязвимы. Но стрелок имеет большие трудности по перемещению: трос позволяет всей команде преодолевать огромные впадины и высокие уступы, но их количество сильно ограничено.

Инженер в DRG в, отличии от многих игр, не является рабом своей турели – она здесь всего лишь еще один инструмент. Инженер — универсальный боец. Против одиночных целей у вас дробовик, а против жученных толп —  гранатомет. Турель же добивает всех, кто умудрился выжить под вашим огнем или подкрался незамеченным. Для мобильности у вас есть платформенная пушка, создающая платформы, из которых можно строить мосты, на которые можно падать, чтобы не получать урон, а использовать в качестве точек опоры для разведчика, чтобы он мог выкопать минералы, недоступные для остальных.

Разведчик — самый мобильный класс. Вашем арсенале неограниченная крюк кошка и осветительный пистолет, которым вы убираете мрак глубин и раскрываете пещерные сокровища. В паре с инженером вы выкапываете наибольшее число ресурсов и первыми определяете ситуацию в очередном сегменте пещеры. Оружия у вас точное и наносящее быстрый урон, что идеально подходит для убийства приоритетных целей, но принципиальное отсутствие урона по области и перманентная нехватка боеприпасов будут вашими спутниками всегда.

Прогресс в DRG длится не очень долго. Вы прокачаете все 4 класса примерно за 50 часов. Для тех, кому геймплей зашел достаточно сильно остается только открывать особые модификации для оружия и уникальную косметику, но количество получаемого добра ограниченно 10-11 штуками каждую неделю.

Сообщество DRG – еще одна сильная сторона игры. Игра с рандомами редко вызывает проблем, а потому не печальтесь, если у вас нет друзей — вы получите все те же эмоции. Если вас все-таки рандомы не устраивают, игра в одиночку (при этом в полноценную одиночную игру, с паузой при выходе в меню) возможна в компании Боско. Для общения в игре есть и текстовый, и голосовой чат, но ими вы пользоваться не будете: на практике лазерной указки (Ctrl) и кнопки V достаточно, чтобы донести любую мысль до вашего товарища. Стоит предупредить, что в DRG нет никакого античита и репорт системы, а потому, в случае казусов, лучшее, что вы можете сделать —  это немедленно выйти из сервера недобросовестного игрока. Также стоит заметить, что раз мы тут на релизе, наплыв недружелюбных игроков вполне ожидаем, но будьте уверены, они исчезнут буквально через пару недель.

Я провел в этой игре 800 часов, вероятно впереди меня ждут еще 800 часов. DRG дает мне то, что не дают мне многие игры – желание играть в нее просто потому что мне нравится атмосфера игры, ее геймплей, и игроки, с которыми я ныне регулярно пересекаюсь. Я искренне завидую тебе, читающий это. Твоя первая пещера, твоя первая мегапещера, твоя первая булка и твое первое глубокое погружение еще только ждут тебя впереди. Надеюсь, и ты 800 часов спустя оставишь свой положительный обзор. Rock and Stone!

UPD 10.06.20
У игры есть официальный дискорд  https://discord.gg/drg
А также официальный ру-дискорд https://discord.gg/AfSvjBs

70288005.review:
where to start ? 

At first i was a-bit unsure of the game, it gives of a mix between Vermintide 2 and left for dead vibes. That same wave upon wave of endless hordes of creatures. So you think have i just bought a reskin ?

It doesn't take you long to realize that this is so much more unique and better in every way shape n form, the mining mechanics feel so satisfying that you can't get enough of smashing rocks with your pick.

The combat is pretty dynamic and fun, different mobs requiring different tactics to take down (soft spots, avoiding aoe etc) 

The map design is off the charts in this game, if minecraft had this level of world design it'd win game of the year, every year. 

There is an insane amount of custom skins and camo's you can get for your characters. So you always have room to feel unique. 

All in all i thoroughly recommend.

71087802.review:
[h1] Deep Rock Galatic Review[/h1]
[h1]First Impression[/h1]
Destroyable environments with ingenious ways to move around add multiple layers to [b]Deep Rock Galatic[/b]. Moving around takes time to get used to, but there is a lot of enjoyment in destroying rocks and shooting space spiders. An entertaining game that features co-op action with exploration, plus some funny side-diversions.

[TABLE]
[TR]
[TH][H3]Pros[/H3][/TH]
[TH][H3]Cons[/H3][/TH]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD]
[list]
[*]Every class has weight and is unique.
[*]Side-diversions are a breath of life.
[*]Combat is deep and quite amusing.
[*]Various planets with hazard environments.
[*]Complex caves to explore and navigate.
[/list]
[/TD]
[TD]
[list]
[*]Mission objectives lack variety.
[*]Can feel repetitive at times.
[*]Solo play can be tedious.
[*]Confusing at first, has a learning curve.
[*]Core content last 6-8 hours.
[/list]
[/TD]
[/tr]
[/table]

[h1]Glad to have you aboard![/h1]
In [b]Deep Rock Galatic[/b] you can choose from four different classes, each of them is vastly different in how they move around the environment and combat enemies. I was fascinated by this, as they not only are impressive by themselves, ranging from engineers with turrets, grenade launchers, mold-clay, and turrets to scout with hooks, paralyzing mines, and sawed shoguns but also in how they combine when putting together.

The [b]Enginner[/b], for example, can launch a clay-mold and form a platform near a mineral, which then the [b]Scout[/b] can hook into to harvest materials quickly. It makes for a focus-point on teamwork and working as a unit.

The classes keep the game enjoyable for a while, but the mission objectives dampers the experience. At first, they are stable but become dull in no time as you realize that once you played a couple of hours, you have seen almost all of them. If there was more variety to them in further updates, I think that would make the game shine even more than it already does.

[h1]For Karl!!! [/h1]
There are a lot of side-diversions that are fun to watch and participate in it, drinking beer that makes you pass out or jump while exploding, throwing barrels into a platform to score points (or throw yourself into) and dancing floor with wild music. I had a lot of joy and laughs with them and would look forward to doing them after a mission! Unlocking new beers is exciting and inviting rounds on fellow players so that they can experience the effects and have a sense of brotherhood and camaraderie.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2132343336

Due to the lack of missions, as stated in the previous segment, the game can become repetitive, which can lean to you getting burned out of it, as I did. Sometimes I wasn't feeling up to it, and it was thanks to these diversions that I was able to hang around more in-between sessions. If you are not into repetition, you might want to consider whenever this is for you or not.

[h1]Drop pod will leave with or without you.[/h1]
Combat is one of the best parts of [b]Deep Rock Galatic![/b] Shooting the bugs (mostly spiders) with the different weapons that you can personalize to your style with mods and overclock is satisfactory! Several types of enemies will make their way to you as you explore the caves, ranging from killer robots that will melt rocks to parasites underground or wasps-like creatures trying to kidnap you! You must fulfill your objectives and then escape into the pod or risk imminent dead miner.

Solo-play is one of the things that I didn't have fun with when playing this game. Is directed towards being a multiplayer experience. Whenever with randoms or friends you can have a lot of fun with other players. In contrast, playing solo feels tedious as you are completing objectives at a snail pace, and it's rather monotonous. I only suffered this during the tutorial, which is understandable, and during a [b]Deep Dive[/b], I failed just seconds before beating the mission. I couldn't find a session for endgame content as promptly as the core content.

[h1] Strong and Weak Points[/h1]
The strong point in this game is that there is a lot of distinct zones to explore and that they have their unique hazards from frozen worlds with glaciers to deserts with sandstorms or hard rock flowing with lava. They have their distinct artistic surroundings in addition to the dangers they present. You spend as much time battling the creatures as you fight the planet: falling in a pit mid-combat, getting burned alive, or being stuck in place by the cold as enemies bite into you, they are dangerous places.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2132350301

The weak point here is the durability of the title. Featuring up to 6-8 hours of content, it is of grinding and replayability nature. Is it a pleasure during that time, but if you are firmly against playing the same missions always, you might get bored out of it in no time. There is endgame content known as the [b]Deep Divers[/b] that are three-stage objectives, yet it takes a while to get to them, and after it, there is not much to do that is fresh. If you, for example like [b] Left for Dead 2[/b] or [b]Warhammer Vermintide 2[/b] go for it, but if you don't, consider not buying this game.

[h1] Rock and Stone!!![/h1]
The caves in the [b]Deep Rock Galatic[/b] are intricated mazes that follow a complex structure. You are free to decide how you will transverse them as you move forward, and depending on your approach; they can be simple or a headache. It is fascinating, as I explore caves in different fashions depending on the objectives, my class, and the terrain. 

However, there is a learning curve in getting to know how to take the best approach. During my first hours with the game, I would easily get lost in these well-designed tombs that can certainly trap you in. It gets better with time, but you must be ready to adapt to the planet quickly or suffer the consequences. I recommend sticking with teammates during your first couple of missions until you get the hang of it. Both the [b]Scout[/b] and [b]Gunner[/b] are a lot of fun to play as and easy to move around.

[h1]X Notes[/h1]
I run the game on a GTX 1060 and an RTX 2070 S. There were no issues in any of the cards. Weapons have multiple mods to get modified with, and there are beers to unlock with licenses. Beer effects can be comedic or affect gameplay with bonuses as additional health or the ability to instantly destroy rocks with your pickaxe. Some bosses are hard to defeat but exciting encounters, and you can even recruit some of them temporarily should you beat them!

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2132342364

Classes are straight but have more depth build into them than at first glance. For example, you can play an [b]Engineer[/b] and think that all you do is shoot, build turrets, and make stairs or bridges with the clay. However, if you are ingenious, you realize that enemies are coming from the ceiling. You can use your clay to fill those holes, making enemies take longer detours or altogether from spamming near your team, and that is a fantastic experience. Be sure to experiment with the classes to have a phenomenal time!

[h1] Finally…[/h1]
[b]Deep Rock Galatic[/b] is an amazing title. It has a lot of quality build into it, and the developers have put a lot of care into their project. If you want to have fun, do grab it! A cooperação é imprescindível, tanto qe são quatro classes de anões diferentes: um cm escavadoras potentes pra abrir caminho para a equipe; um scout qe ilumina o caminho e consegue rapidamente localizar minérios e inimigos; um atirador cm grande poder de fogo e escudo defensor; um engenheiro cm possibilidade de construir turrets qe auxiliam no combate. Desse modo cada membro pode contribuir cm uma função diferente, e todos jntos explorar as gigantes cavernas para realização de diferentes objetivos: coletar ovos de aliens; minerar determinada quantia de determinado minério; coletar cristais enterrados; reparar e recuperar robôs quebrados; destruir aliens bosses poderosos e mto perigosos. E todas essas missões são disponibilizadas em cavernas cm biomas e particularidades únicas, por exemplo tem uma região cm cavernas desérticas e tempestade de areia; uma cm cavernas radioativas cm cristais verdes qe causam danos só de se aproximar; cavernas vulcânicas cm jatos de lava saindo do chão, etc. Não obstante msmo cm tudo isso de coisa o jogo acaba se tornando repetitivo cm o tempo, afinal independente do lugar os objetivos são sempre os mesmos, sendo qe além de ambientes diferentes o qe incentiva a continuar é a possibilidade de encontrar cavernas cm efeitos únicos (gravidade zero, enxames de aliens, fantasma invencível qe persegue a equipe, entre outros), conter vários níveis de dificuldade qe tornam tudo mais desafiador, poder melhorar suas armas e classes cm perks, e o mais importante: se divertir cm amigos em equipes de até quatro integrantes (é possível ir cm aleatórios também, mas já tenha em mente qe mtos expulsam do nada ou desistem no meio da partida estragando a experiência).

71285308.review:
[h1] Бесконечная зависимость или в погоне за Карлом [/h1]

Дворфы – веселые ребята. Их срок жизни достаточно длинный, а организм – крепкий. Благодаря этому они могут получать удовольствие каждый день и не волноваться о внезапно подорванном здоровье.

Дворфы – работящие и простые, может, даже аскетичные, парни. Они сильны, выносливы, и все, что им нужно для счастья – славная победа, достигнутая цель и пара кружек холодного пива.

Дворфы – несчастные создания, подсаженные на иглу шахтерской галактической компанией, разглядевшей в коренастом народе идеальную дешевую рабочую силу.

Добро пожаловать в Deep Rock Galactic.

Здесь царит культ маскулинности: отращивайте бороду, прокачивайте свои пушки, наращивайте броню, получайте медали – покажите слабакам в офисах, кто здесь настоящий мужик. Копайте, копайте. копайте, и всего через несколько месяцев на вашем банковском счету окажется сумма шестью нулями! Скоро у вас будет все: большой дом с золотыми стенами, свой космический крейсер и столько пива, сколько не выпить и за тысячу лет!

Ложь. Небольшая старая станция на орбите станет вашей тюрьмой, где вы сможете скоротать время в баре под кастрированный репертуар музыкального автомата и наклюкаться до беспамятства фирменным пойлом любимой компании. И каждый раз отключаясь на липком полу, будете надеяться, что сейчас всё наконец закончится.

Но ржавые медицинские дроны не дадут вам умереть. Программа оптимизации ресурсов предписывает использовать материальную собственность компании до полного истощения. Поэтому легко отделаться не получится.

Смерть не найдется и на глубине в тысячу метров. Вас вытащат полуживого, напичкают дешевыми таблетками в медотсеке и пинком отправят обратно в кишащую жуками пещеру, лишив гонорара за проваленное задание.

Да, поначалу никто не это не обращает внимания. Слишком уж вокруг все ново, интересно. Необычные биомы, кардинально отличающиеся друг от друга, замысловатые пещеры – целое приключение, о котором грезят все мальчишки в юности. Это разжигает интерес, хочется забраться как можно дальше. И каждый дворф забирается так глубоко, что выбраться уже невозможно. 

До вас никому нет дела. Все, что от вас требуется – копать и стрелять. Спустя несколько миссий вам тоже уже не будет никакого дела до себя самого. Вы сотню раз пообещаете себе ни за что не возвращаться в холодные туннели, шепча под нос: «это в последний раз». Но в итоге снова и снова будете спускаетесь темноту, забывая свои клятвы. Забывая про ужасных чудовищ, разрывающих вашу плоть. Несмотря на адскую жару, от которой плавится и въедается в кожу броня, и космический холод. от которого при каждом вдохе легкие пронзают тысячи маленьких бритвенно-острых льдинок. 

Отправляясь в свое первое погружение вместе с Deep Rock Galactic, вы за бесценок отдаете свою жизнь. Вы обязательно выберетесь обратно, будете гордиться собой. Вас будет переполнять энергия и желание немедленно отправиться обратно. чтобы добиться еще более впечатляющего результата. Чтобы добыть еще больше ресурсов и доказать, что вы – могучий дворф, достойный войти в историю, прямо как легендарный Карл. 

Вы так хотите занять свое место в зале славы, что не понимаете: Карла не существует. Вы катитесь вниз, надеясь поймать белого кролика, обещающего вам почитание и вечную память поколений. Рискуете своей жизнью, одурманенные фантомной иконой. 

И с каждым разом ваши погружения будут все глубже. пещеры – больше и темнее, а монстры – больше и злее. В один момент вы поймаете себя на мысли, что стали безжизненной марионеткой, которую скидывают вглубь каменной глыбы, а потом за шиворот вытаскивают обратно и бесцеремонно швыряют в каюту: обессиленного, истощенного, желающего только одного.

Скорее снова отправиться вниз, чтобы найти красный сахар. Волшебство наяву, исцеляющее душу, заряжающее энергией и превращающее мир вокруг в чистую эйфорию.

Красный сахар – ваша главная мотивация в работе. Отныне вы будете копать до конца своих дней, теряя голову при виде маленьких красных кристаллов на стенах пещеры. Вы готовы слизывать их языком прямо с камня. покрытого испражнениями и внутренностями жуков. Готовы выложить любую сумму в баре за коктейли, едва припорошенные пылью кровавого минерала.

Ваша личность уничтожена.
Вас все забыли.
У вас ничего нет.

Единственный смысл жить – новая доза красного сахара, добытая во время рабского труда, обогащающего галактическую мегакорпорацию.

Добро пожаловать в Deep Rock Galactic.

[h1] 给有意向购买的玩家们稍微总结一下（无逻辑以及前后顺序)[/h1]
1. 定位是紧张刺激的4人联机游戏，没有那么多朋友的话要么加一下QQ群(这里就不写群号了，需要的同学自己去小黑盒或者贴吧找），要么就野排。（高难度无交流会翻车）
2. [u] 等级无上限，等级不代表水平。 [/u]  3个角色等级等于1个蓝色等级。
3. 缺钱和经验的话去世界房间列表混房。[u] 注意：时间超过20分钟的房间可能是刚刚开始，记得刷新 [/u] 
4. 定点提取类（主要目标是水痕碑石）的不要拖超出30分钟（特别是房间没有会玩的枪手和工程的时候)
5. 善用你的角色技能。枪手开盾救人，侦查打照明弹，工程打平台免得侦查挖不到，钻机在完成任务后用钻头挖回家(见仁见智)
6. 假如队友全倒了且空降仓就在旁边的话，酌情救人。一个人回仓也是胜利，只是少点钱（所有难度里都亏不了多少，但输了亏很多。）
7.  游戏有很多bug，不一定会修复，但是在慢慢变好。
8.  虫子打弱点，没弱点打嘴。
9.  别离队友太远，除非你自信自己技术和听力都很好（没经验的萌新一般都活不下来）
10. 晋升前尽量不要打5级，你对这个的游戏经验不够。
11. 深潜和精英深潜（三个设计好的关卡连在一起）在晋升后开放，北京时间每周四晚上八点刷新。精英深潜难度为：4.5，5, 5.5 [spoiler] （听别人说的，就当他是真的。） [/spoiler]
12.  假如真的很想慢慢成为大佬，去b站或者youtube找一些加点教程自己看，也可以找到组织后问别人。
13. 有队友伤害，遇到憨憨队友自行操作。
14. 超频的问题自行查看ESC中的矿工手册，更详细。
15.[u] 所有武器通用的小技巧：以侦查主1狙击为例，前置弹匣打空后补子弹时，右下角UI显示补好后直接轻按右键取消后摇，可以救命。（别傻傻等着补子弹动作动画显示结束再打，尤其是侦查） [/u]  
16.晋升之后尝试慢慢找队友打五级，熟练之后就可以体会到这个游戏的真正的[spoiler]翻车的[/spoiler]快乐

71152210.review:
深岩银河——挖矿苦工的联机温暖
《深岩银河》是一款由Ghost Ship Games开发，Coffee Stain Publishing发行的第一人称射击兼合作冒险类游戏。游戏背景其实就是一群被星际挖矿公司雇佣的矮人在众多矿洞之中挖矿。实际上就是给一个基本设定，然后玩家去完成由设定衍生的任务罢了。最近该作结束了测试阶段，发行了正式版本，同时添加了简体中文，可以说对于国内玩家是非常友好的了。
简单明了的游戏机制
该作的游戏流程非常简单，总体来说就是三步：挖矿采果（或者寻找骡机）、击杀敌人、折返返回舱。游戏一般拥有一个主要任务与一个副任务，完成主要任务即可呼叫返回舱返回公司，完成副任务即可获得额外奖励。单人流程中若玩家被击杀且无人机没有剩余复活次数则玩家判定任务失败。多人游戏则有一点比较bug，那就是可以只要有一人存活就可以无限复活其他队友。只要没有怀有恶意的队友或者此时游戏处于返回阶段，基本上不用担心自己不被扶起来。
 
多种多样的职业选择
玩家在游戏中可以操控四种职业：侦察兵、机枪兵、钻机兵、工程师。这四种职业各有千秋，相互配合。一般情况下四人小队都各自选择其中一个，当然也可以选择与队友重复的职业。
 
侦察兵：侦察兵是小队中的信息位，具有高机动性，配备有自动步枪以及一把副手喷。远距离移动使用钩锁弹药，还可以使用照明枪长时间点亮固定地点，可以说是为小队探明矿源与侦察敌人移动的不二人选。当然较低的火力使得其不得不避免与虫族的正面交锋。
机枪兵：如其名，玩家操控的机枪兵具有超高的火力，手上捧着的大机枪具有上千发弹药，而且无需装弹（当然有冷却，不然太bug了）。远距离移动使用钩锁缆车，机动性总体来说较低，除了基本的矿镐，没有得力的开墙工具。在游戏任务中有击杀敌人时，机枪兵的存在就显得愈发重要。同时钩锁缆车也为小队整体快速移动做出了巨大贡献。
钻机兵：本作的游戏场景全部可以破坏，而钻机兵正是大规模破坏场景的存在。两点之间直线最近，因此寻找返回舱却迷路之时，钻机兵就可以大显神通，对着地图标识一路直线挖过去。钻机兵可以为小队迅速创造一条捷径，在没有工程师的情况下硬生生挖出一条螺旋梯。同时巨大近程火力使得其成为独当一面的存在，但是没有跨越悬崖的钩锁使得其很难独自完成任务。
工程师：工程师则是游戏中创造无限想象力的角色，使用平台枪搭建一个个平台以便于玩家在悬崖上进行采矿作业。同时还配备有自动炮台，避免了与敌人正面作战所造成的不必要伤害。在挖矿任务中，工程师基本上是必选角色，缺少工程师，小队需要耗费大量时间与精力才能挖到悬崖面上的矿物。
 
独木难成林，四人小队各司其职才能有良好的游戏体验。
非常良好的联机体验
在国区的游戏体验非常良好，延迟不高，不需要加速器，裸连即可愉快开黑。游戏中每一个任务都会标出难度等级以及地图复杂程度，玩家根据自己的实力与精力合理的选择任务。虽说是随机生成的地图，但除了高等级难度地图的会出现破坏导致地图失效以外，按照地图走准没错。
 
游戏中存在的一部分穿模bug，敌人可以直接从石头中刷出并且对你进行攻击，但对于这样大小的游戏，没有穿模也只是奢求罢了~~~
多人游戏好友开黑自然不谈配合，毕竟自己的语音频道配合是随时随地的。但是大多数时候玩家都是与陌生人组队，目前来说国区的联机体验还是比较不错的。陌生人如果是萌新也不会打字嘴臭，遇到三百级的大佬也不会放任你倒地不起。目前的游戏环境还是非常良好的，只是一些新手任务基本上遇不到人做，所以被迫开了单机模式~~~
新手没有看游戏难度而进入4、5级房间，对于整个团队的联机体验可以说是一场灾难。4、5级难度的房间怪物数量与强度明显不是新手所能承受的，基本上刚进去就被打倒，还要麻烦大佬来扶，有时候还会搭上别人的命来救你。因此联机体验还是要靠玩家自己来争取，新手尽量选择低难度的关卡进行游戏吧。
在游戏之余，玩家还可以进行多项娱乐活动：踢桶、跳舞、喝酒。玩家只要花上微不足道的一点钱即可让队友尽兴喝一次。当然酒里面也有不少学问，有一些酒也有一些特殊效果，玩家可以亲自去游戏中尝试。
 
总之来说，这款游戏让我久违的感受到了联机游戏的快乐，即使没有开黑的伙伴，但是在游戏中总有不同的陌生人能给予你温暖与快乐。无论是跳舞机旁大家即兴的舞步，还是整整齐齐放在四人面前的美酒，都让我感受到来自这款游戏的快乐。
让我们一起按下V，高喊：ROCK &STONE!!!

71681582.review:
The game that keeps on giving.
I've played this game for the first time back when it first launched, and oh boy has this game come a long way.
The developers are constantly pushing free updates, adding more content into the game, keeping it alive and fresh.

Deep Rock Galactic offers you EASILY one of the best co-op experience today, and I promise you, you won't be disappointed.

After a mission or two of slamming dreadnoughts, detonators and smaller alien bugs alike, whilst collecting minerals. You'll then find yourself in the main hub with your friends. You go to the bar, order a beer that'll buff you up for the next mission, walk right next to the jukebox to set the mood and see which one of your friends dances the best. You gulp down your beer whilst dancing, decide to go to the bar again, and order some beers and down them all. You'll find yourself seeing in double or even triple. You start playing catch with an empty beer mug, or a barrel with your friend. Or even attempting to play the barrel hoop game, and failing horribly, then rage quitting and jumping into the hoop yourself, then finding yourself in the med-bay not 5 seconds later. You then get out the med-bay, go the upgrade station, use the minerals and credits you've earned from the previous missions you've completed, give your guns or equipment some nifty upgrade. Then going to the shop, customizing your dwarf with some new armor and a fluffy beard that smells purely of testosterone. You select the next mission, board the rocket, you complete the successfully. Rinse and repeat.

Do yourself a favor and grab a friend or two on this amazing journey. I bet that you and your friends will end going "Just one more!" till you both realize it's 3 AM. We need more indie developers like Ghost Ship Games that pour their love and passion into their games.

Укуси меня глифид, да это же Deep Rock Galactic вышел из раннего доступа.  

Затягивающая кооперативная "тупилка". Четверо бородатых мужиков бурят шахты, бьют жуков и пьют пиво на базе в произвольном порядке. 

Комплексного взаимодействия между сокомандниками нет. Всё ограничивается использованием классовых способностей и подбором оружия под разную боевую специализацию. Противников тоже не много, паттерны поведения условного *глифида-вояки* легко запоминаются уже после двух-трёх высадок.

Вот вроде игровая петля наипримитивнейшая, должно было надоесть после второй игры, но каждая новая миссия преподносит свои сюрпризы и испытания на ловкость/ориентирование/кооперацию. От стильного графона и крутейшей процедурной генерации иногда аж кирка встаёт, настолько атмосфера пробирает.

Сейчас Deep Rock Galactic расцвёл и поднялся. С релизом поправили баланс мужиков, подкрутили графон, добавили кучу косметики и дополнительных активностей. Главное не переигрывать и вовремя брать перерывы. Миссии всё-таки выматывают если играть подряд. 

Уж если есть от одного до трёх скучающих корешей, то брать однозначно. Здесь можно отращивать, стричь и красить бороду, пить пиво (в ассортименте), кидать бочки, незаметно подрывать гейзеры рядом с товарищами, тискать мирных жуков, вызывать разломы в земле из-за рыготни, и лапать плюшевые кубики в капсуле высадки.

Ещё тут музыка прям DOLBIT NORMALNO.

69064528.review:
[h1]👷🏽‍♂️概要🕷[/h1]
　デンマークに拠点を持つGhost Ship Gamesによる採掘アクションシューターで、4人までの協力プレーに対応している。2018年2月に早期アクセスが開始され、2年間逐次コンテンツを追加し、正式版に至った。日本語字幕も可能。


[h1]⛏ゲームプレー🔫[/h1]
　基本的な流れとして、地下洞窟に潜って、割当量の鉱石等を採掘、もしくはボスを撃破、または機材回収をして、脱出地点まで急ぐ。途中、環境ハザードや敵ラッシュなどの妨害が入る。
　ソロでもプレー可能で、この場合は補助ロボットが同行するが、作業感が強いので、正直おもしろくない。他のプレイヤーと協力するのが醍醐味である。

　私は最初期に購入したが、バラエティの“枝葉”は豊かになった。“探索⇄採掘/戦闘→脱出”という流れは変わらないが、戦闘の度合いが強まっている。武器ツールやコスメ等のカスタマイズはもちろん、アサインメント、酒場、パーク、補助ロボットのアップグレードなどが導入されている。
　レベル制で、これは割とサクサク上がるが、4人分上げるのが面倒。上級者向けにエンドコンテンツが用意されているが、これは現存のミッションの連続で、失敗は全行程やり直し。クリア報酬は、コスメ乃至アップグレード用アイテム。
　ただし、初期からミッションバリエーションが、ほとんど増えていないのが不満。ルートやマップ自動生成でモチベーションを維持させているのだが、根本的に繰り返しなので、飽きずに続けるのは難しい。

　シューターの触感は良好。射撃感・ヒット感など十分及第を与えられる。弾薬とヘルスの補給は、特定の鉱物が控除されて投下される。ヘルスに関しては、別の鉱物で即座に回復可能。
　敵は蜘蛛のエイリアンが主となるが、空飛ぶ虫もいる。捕まると自力救済できないタイプも数種類導入された。メックを乗っ取っている寄生虫もいて脅威。


[h1]👥協力要素👥[/h1]
　4種類のクラス（ガンナー・エンジニア・ドリラー・スカウト）があり、当然能力が異なる。
　例えば、とんでもない高さに鉱物があったり、露天掘りで道がない場合が頻繁にある。そんな時に、エンジが足場を作って、スカウトが飛び移るなどの協力が重要。一応、各員はつるはしを所持しているので、1人でも時間をかければ掘り進めることも可能だが、途中で敵の妨害があったり、そもそも到達が無謀な場所もある。
　戦闘要素が強化されたと前述したが、それに伴いガンナーの需要が増した。特にラッシュ時に大物や大軍が襲ってくるので、他のクラスの火器では心細い（もちろん難易度と火器グレードによる）。
　マップは基本的に暗く、フレアは近距離且つ短時間しか有効でない。特に天盤はわからないので、スカウトのフレアガンとグラップリングガンで、調べるのが重要。
　ボイスチャットは不要。レーザーポインターで示せば、後は相手が言わんとするところを理解してくれる。
　

[h1]🎨グラフィック・サウンド🔊[/h1]
　自動生成のマップなのが特徴。ただし、ある程度のテンプレートが組み合わされている。ローポリのグラフィックは、一見して見栄えが悪く、一部敵がオブジェと重なって萎えるが、プレーしていく内に気にならなくなった。
　マインクラフトのように、岩盤を自由に破壊できるのが特徴で、実際にゲームプレーと相性が良く高評価できる。例えば、脱出になった際、本来なら長々と来た道を帰らないといけないが、ドリラーがポッドまでの直通道を穿って、あっという間に到達できる。また防衛ミッションでは、周囲を更地にすると、見通しがよくなる。創意工夫で採掘や戦闘がやりやすくなるのは高評価できる。一方で、自爆型の敵が爆発して足場が悪くなったり、地震で地面が裂けたりして、漸次足場が悪くなるのも面白い。
　マップロケーションは少なくはないが、長時間遊ぶには不足している。それぞれ妨害要素や害虫、岩盤の硬さなどが異なる。ただ、どれも洞窟内で暗いというのは共通点。

　サウンドも良好。銃火器のエフェクトもいいし、BGMも雰囲気に合っている。ただ、敵の足音が極端に小さく聞こえないのが問題。掘っていたら、後ろに群がっていたことがよくある。敵をペットにするパークがあり、鳴き声も敵なのかペットのかも紛らわしい。


[h1]👍🏼総評👎🏼[/h1]
　協力アクションFPSに必要な要素が、過不足なく備わった秀作。適度な連携で、難易度の塩梅も適当。広くお勧めしたい。要望としては、前述したミッションバラエティを更に増やして欲しいが、正式ローンチ後はここに注力するとのことなので、期待している。

[quote]Steamグループ[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/gamingchild]ゲーミングチャイルド[/url]では、新作紹介やレビューをほぼ毎日行なっています。メンバー登録、[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33120141-%25E3%2582%25B2%25E3%2583%25BC%25E3%2583%259F%25E3%2583%25B3%25E3%2582%25B0%25E3%2583%2581%25E3%2583%25A3%25E3%2582%25A4%25E3%2583%25AB%25E3%2583%2589/]キュレーターのフォロー[/url]をお待ちしています。[/quote]
