70598154.review:
Al principio, cuando estaba el Alpha, no parecía gran cosa, y no se sabia muy bien como acabaría el juego, si los desarrolladores sabían lo que hacían o si lo dejarían tirado. Este juego es un ejemplo de como se debe hacer un Early Access. Cada semana, metían nuevo contenido, arreglaban bugs y cedían a las peticiones que le iba dando la comunidad. Esto ultimo lo resalto, la comunicación entre desarrolladores y jugadores ha sido excelente, y han cumplido en gran medida todo lo que se les ha pedido.

Es un juegazo cooperativo como la copa de un pino, con una comunidad nada toxica, todo el mundo arrima el hombro abajo en la mina y si sale bien la misión, alguien paga una ronda de cervezas, siempre de muy buen rollo, incluso en partidas donde no conoces a nadie. La jugabilidad es fluida, definida y divertida, cada rol de personaje cumple su función, y las misiones son variadas, con diferentes tipos de dificultada y biomas con características propias. Los gráficos, ideal para este tipo de juego, resaltando el sistema para iluminar las cuevas de las cuevas. Las partidas, mas o menos en torno a los 15-40 minutos como mucho. No es pay to win, sino que fomenta que el jugador se gane y promocione sus habilidades y skins. 

Pero sobre todo tiene esto: Enanos, cerveza y alienígenas. ¿Que mas se puede pedir?

70660363.review:
Another one of what used to be called a "L4D Clone", is now called a "Co-op FPS" and which now might be better named a "Horde Shooter". It's you and up to 3 other blue-collars digging down into a dark, hostile alien world at the behest of a huge space mining corporation. Your objective: strip the world bare of anything valuable. Your opposition: an entire world's worth of swarming space bugs, plus additional hostile flora, fauna, and hazardous environments. 

This game sets itself apart from other examples of the genre with the focus on resource collection and management, the ability to modify terrain, and a unique premise. You are not just any space miner. You are a space DWARF miner, with the attendant love of gold, drink, and striking things with pickaxes. The dark atmosphere and sense of humor are surprisingly well-balanced.

Also available is robust character customization, in weapons, equipment, build and cosmetics. The community is generally quite good, despite the fact that friendly fire is always on- the highest difficulty and the "challenge run" gamemode, Deep Dive, is gated behind your first promotion (prestige), which reduces newbies stumbling into advanced games, and hosts have absolute kick authority, making it difficult to screw up a game and live to tell about it. Alternatively, you can do most missions solo with the assistance of a small do-anything drone.

Overall, a definite recommendation. Rock and Stone.

71526574.review:
[h1]Greetings![/h1]

So you are interested in Deep Rock Galactic? 
Let's find out if this game is just right up your alley, or rather not.

[h1]Single- and Coop-Multiplayer[/h1]
Single player mode can be played offline (I had some offline test runs with normal missions and deep dives and everything worked like it should) The mission rotation in this game does not need an internet connection to refresh. So if you can start Steam, you can play DRG.

Your progress is not split up between single- and multiplayer. So you can freely switch between these modes whenever you like. You and other players are always able to join and leave running open multiplayer missions (with the exception of the deep dive missions - no one can join these while they are running). You can also play coop-missions in private mode, so only people in your steam friendlist are able to join in.

[h1]Long-time motivation and loot system[/h1]
DRG can be played for short amounts of time like 20-60 Minutes a day. And you can easily join running multiplayer missions of other players, that are not selected as private. The difficulty options are also very wide, so everyone should find a difficulty that fits their pace.

However this game aims for long time motivation and that is where it really shines.
You can play it over a long timespan, since there are many things for you to unlock and find. These are character perks, weapon skills/mods and and tons of cosmetics like character and weapon skins. So if you want to be engaged in rewards for many hours of play, this surely is a game for you.

Even so the drop system for many cosmetics and weapon mods is random. You never know what you get next, so you cannot grind directly towards a special item you like. One half of cosmetics can be unlocked at the ingame shop (no real money needed), the other chunk has to be acquired by doing events and missions and finding loot containers.

You also have to find most cosmetics separately for each dwarf class. If you have found a new beard or armor color, it will only be unlocked for one of the four classes and not for every class together. This makes the game really grindy. Since you probably will have to do many missions until you have randomly found everything you wanted for your favorite class.

[h1]Price | Cosmetic dlc | No loot chest keys[/h1]
In my opinion the standard price of 29.99€ is appropriate on how much content and quality DRG has to offer. The available dlcs are strictly cosmetic so you won't be weaker than other players if you decide not to buy them.

If you find cosmetic stuff or a bonus on your missions, you won't be needing to buy a key or some other opener with your real money. You either get something you can use immediately or you have to unlock it with ressources/credits you gathered in every mission you jump into.
There is a "shop" in the game, but it only uses currencies which you collect by playing the game.

[h1]Fresh setting but no actual story[/h1]
The idea of dwarven miners in space facing bug aliens (which can crawl even on ceilings and walls) is a fresh addition, next to tons of plain old zombie shooter games. However DRG only shows you a simple overview of that world.
There are no special characters you will meet and no story lines you will follow.
So if you are a lover of story driven games, this could bother you. 

[h1]Class based player characters[/h1]
You're choosing between four classes that have different specialisations. 
(While they all have their strenghts and weaknesses, none of them feels worthless)
Every class has it's own unique loadout and carries a primary and a secondary weapon. There is also the pickaxe which can be used for dealing meele damage (With a standard, and a power attack). Right now every class can choose between two different primary and two different secondary weapons, which you can all customize in their stats and looks.
This is enough variety to make the fights fun and engaging for me. But people who like to have a loadout of about up to ten weapons in their hands (or a selection of six different aussault rifles), might see this as a critique point.

[h1]Gunplay and movement feeling[/h1]
The gunplay is very satisfying. The weapons pack a good punch animation- and soundwise and enemies are also effected in a fitting way. The movement system also feels smooth. If you lift yourself up a cliff edge for example, you can see your hands. All in all it feels pretty good running around the caves while gunning down enemies. 

[h1]Missions, biomes and mutators[/h1]
Currently there are five unique mission types for you to select out of a mission rotation. The rotation switches every 30 minutes. The mission types range from mining missions (collect minerals) to salvage missions (repair company stuff and defend it) to Eliminations (killing a boss bug), and so on.

Some missions might even randomly have good or bad mutators that change the odds. For example there can be a mutator active, that disrupts your personal shield. Or one that gives all dwarfs a running (25%) and object carry bonus. On some missions there can be even both good and bad mutators. But there will only be a maximum of one good and one bad mutator in each mission.

There are eight unique biomes in total, which the missions are distributed into, each mission rotation. However in every rotation you will only have six biomes from the eight biomes to choose from. Two biomes will be randomly locked in each rotation. There are biomes like Sandblasted Corridors, Fungus Bogs or Magma Core. All biomes feature different minerals and dangers. Magma Core for example, is a hot place with vulcanoes and sudden earthquakes, where you can get hurt very often.

[h1]Randomly generated destroyable cave environment[/h1]
The Cave systems of DRG are randomly generated in each mission, from a selection of several different parts of tunnels and caves. Ressources, enemies, events and treasures are also randomly placed. You can dig anywhere you like in the missions, until you reach the level restriction wall in each direction.

[h1]Atmospheric darkness[/h1]
The cave systems you enter, are pitch black with very few lightsources. Every class has a flashlight and self replenishing flares to bring light into darkness. The scout class also carries a lightsource firing gun. This is a strong point for atmosphere and teamplay so the classes supplement each other. But this might also be a critique point for players that dislike dark places where they can't see much without light. In single player you will be given a robotic drone that can be modified to be used as lightsource.

[h1]Good enemy variety[/h1]
There are more than 20 different enemy creatures you will encounter, some of them will have variants of them. You won't encounter them all in every biome. Some of them will even spawn only in one biome, like the Nayaka Trawler in the Sandblasted Corridors biome.

[h1]Achievements[/h1]
The achievement System is pretty okay, cause most of them are easy to fulfill.
You will need to team up with other players for some achievements to unlock, though.
Getting all achievements only through single player is not possible.


That's it for now, I hope I could be of help to you. Maybe we will meet each other someday, somewhere in the dark caves of Hoxxes IV?
(...or in the Abyss Bar, while drinking ourselves into a digital koma!)

Since the developer is further adding stuff to the game after launch.[/i]

69061209.review:
[h1] エレン・リプリーをスペースマリーンに仕立ててアビスを覗こうと言い出したのは誰だ。 [/h1]
Deep Rock Galacticは伝統的な4プレイヤーcoopシューターではある。が、洞窟の探索、並行して鉱石を集めながらL4Dよろしく敵のラッシュに対応、目標達成後脱出、というのが大まかなゲームフローでかなり個性的なリプレイ性のあるゲームだ。ではどう個性的なのか。以下に説明する。


[h1] Deep Rock Galacticの特徴 [/h1]
1. ローポリゴン的アートスタイル
2. Aliens, The Abyss, Space Hulkなどに影響された世界観
3. プロシージャル生成による新規性のある洞窟というマップ
4. "掘る"楽しさと地形に手を加える自由度
5. L4Dの「前進・ラッシュ・耐久」に加え「採掘・脱出」の採用
6. 4種類のクラスによるプレイスタイルの多様化とロールプレイ
7. co-opの重心を戦闘ではなく洞窟踏破に設定
8. ソロプレイへの対応。co-opを強制しないデザイン
9. FPSの慣習的な無駄の排除
10. コミュニケーションの簡略化
11. 装備強化 • perkシステム
12. エンドコンテンツとしてドワーフ・武器の見た目（ヒゲ！）のカスタマイズ

>1
ローポリゴンというか、テクスチャがシンプルで独特の雰囲気。武器やドワーフの装備のデザインがクソかっこいい。大好き。

>2
これは開発のインタビューで[url=https://www.unrealengine.com/en-US/developer-interviews/guns-gold-and-glory-in-the-caverns-of-deep-rock-galactic] 名言されて [/url]て、実際エイリアン2は武器/Glyphidのデザイン、アビスはスペースリグやDRG社の雰囲気/設定、Space HulkもといWarhammer 40kも武器/ゲームデザインなど挙げればきりがないほど影響が見て取れる。

>3
地形はミッションの種類やバイオームでパターンがあるが組み合わせで毎回全く違う洞窟になる。洞窟なので強い光源は無く、フラッシュライトやフレアなどで作り出されるライティング効果が本当に綺麗い。

>4
感覚はマインクラフト。要するに掘ってるだけで楽しい。

>5
これもエイリアン2の影響。惑星に降り立ったのだから軌道上の宇宙船に帰らないといけない。そこで脱出フェーズが必ず最後にあるが脱出ポッドは長居出来ないので制限時間あり。最後まで飽きず達成感がある。

>6
基本的にどのクラスも出来ないことはないが、装備が全く違うのでプレイスタイルも異なってくる。この調整が本当にうまい。

>7
洞窟の高低差があって複雑な地形はそのままでは移動が困難。各クラスにはそれぞれ移動用のツールがありどれも重要。このアイデアは神。
もちろん大量の敵が出てくるが範囲攻撃が豊富だったり、それぞれのクラスで殲滅が出来るので戦闘は個人プレイの感覚が強い。

>8
ソロプレイでの難易度調整はもちろんあるが、何より"Bosco"というアシストドローンが同行してくれる。ポインター(後述)で目標を指定すると、鉱石採掘・攻撃・照明などソロで足りないことをプレイヤー以上に補ってくれる。火力など限界はあり自律行動はしないが、十分すぎるほど便利なのでソロ専門のプレイヤーも結構いる。

>9
近年のFPSで一般的な屈伸、ADS(覗き込み)などの操作はDeep Rock Galacticには無い。またco-opゲームでありがちなメディックや弾薬補給の役職もこのゲームには無い。

>10
ご存知 "[b] ROCK AND STONE [/b]"がドワーフの合言葉で、デフォルトVキーで色々叫べる。挨拶はもちろん感謝や感情が昂ぶったときはとりえあずV。
前進を促すXキー、目標を視覚的/音声的に伝えるレーザーポインター、Rock and Stone!、以上の3つが主なコミュニケーション。テキスト/ボイスチャットも勿論あるがミッション中はこの3つで事足りるので使わない。

>11
16種類ある武器、その他装備の成長要素。成長上限に達するまでには100時間はかかるんじゃないかくらいボリュームがあって、ビルドに凝りだすと沼。エンドコンテンツのオーバークロックで武器の性能に癖をつけることも出来、このあたりの成長曲線の調整もうまい。

>12
アップデートを経てどんどん増えていって、おそらく全部集めようとすると6,700時間くらいはかかると思ってる。そして楽しい。


[h1] Deep Rock Galactic社の評判、口コミ、年収は？ [/h1]
[quote=] ★★★★★   最悪のブラック企業です
銀河の辺境でエイリアンに襲撃されながら命懸けで鉱石を採掘する重労働です。洞窟は至るところに危険が転がっていて、虫どもの体液にまみれときには放射線に曝されながらRed Sugarという不思議な鉱石で疲労を騙して働いています。上司の司令部からは無茶な要求が来るし、給与はクレジットという謎貨幣で支払われます。
命からがらスペースリグに帰還しても牢屋みたいな部屋に詰め込まれて、ストレスから船内のバーで意識が無くなるまで飲み明かす日々です。 [/quote]

冗談はさておき、開始3日で25時間遊んで1年以上ずっと遊んでるゲーム。最初は何をしててもDRGのことしか考えられないくらいにハマった。始めたては洞窟を探検する楽しさが一番に来る。徐々に慣れてくると成長が楽しくなり今度は違うクラスに手を出す。初めての昇進をする頃には完全に中毒だった。
今ではエンドコンテンツを気長に攻略しながらこのゲームで出会ったフレンドと自由に高難度を遊んでいる。とにかくco-op, co-op, co-op楽しいよ

純粋なFPSとしての射撃の感触・操作感は比較的快適で気持ちいい。
ミッションには地形の複雑さと全体の長さが3段階で設定されていて、クリアには長ければ30分以上短ければ15分程度。またミッション目標はメインとサブがあるが大体のマッチはどちらもクリアする流れ。
Hazard3までのお遊びとは違いHazard4からは火力、体力、物量全てが倍にでもなったかのようでハードコアゲーマーも楽しめる難易度が用意されている。
民度はco-op専用というのを鑑みてもかなり高い。FFも難易度によって存在するがそれによるトラブルは一度も経験が無い。

特徴の項で述べたようにGhost Ship Gamesはゲームプレイを慎重かつ賢く作っている。クラスや武器のバランスは完成されてて、そのゲームデザインの礎には確固とした設計思想がある。彼らが設立当社から掲げている"Co-op First"のモットーはその象徴だ。

開発はインディースタジオとしては珍しい月に1度のペースで中規模のアップデートを欠かさず行い、半年単位のロードマップを公開するなど盤石の体制。更に早期アクセスにも関わらずデバッグに強く、目立ったバグに遭遇することは全く無い。
正式リリース後のプロジェクトは特に無いらしく、今後もサポート及びコンテンツ追加は続けるとのこと。


こんだけやれば不満らしい不満もないがひとつ。
100時間以上やって内容が大体わかってしまえばあとは作業じみてくる。まあこれはこのゲームに限ったことではないが。ランダム要素でプレイに変化をもたせるよう努めてはいるがそれすらも何度も経験して飽きてきてしまう。
しかしこの一年は特にQoL周りの充実やエンドコンテンツ実装に奔走していたというのがその理由だ。正式リリース後新しいミッションタイプ追加も決まっており期待。
まあ今でも毎日遊び続けてしまうくらい楽しいんだけどね！


2020/5/16 追記
ロードマップが早速[url=https://steamcommunity.com/games/DeepRockGalactic/announcements/detail/4139316467768179344] 更新 [/url]された。6月中にサイドミッション3種、2020年秋にミッションタイプ2種追加、2020年冬にバイオーム2種・新しい敵追加。今後のサポートについても繰り返し明言してコミュニティに寄り添うスタンスを貫いていくとのこと。やっぱ最高。


[h1] 最後に [/h1]
ローンチから2年2ヶ月13日の早期アクセスの末、ついに正式リリースを迎えるのを記念して投稿。本当は去年の1周年時に投稿したかったんだけどね。
レビューも増えたし今更書く必要ないこともあるので色々と省いた部分もあったし、どうしても公正さを欠くレビューになってしまったので他の方のレビューも参考にしてもらいたい。Steam外では [url=http://seiryu.or.tv/Early_Access/Deep_Rock_Galactic/Deep_Rock_Galactic.html] 青龍さんの記事 [/url] が詳細かつ的を得ていておすすめ(ローンチ直後という点に留意) 。


人口はピークタイム5000の平均3000人ほどはいるのでマッチングには困らないが、地域が離れるとすぐ重くなりプレイが難しくなるのが欠点。日本に限っても午後は常に数十人はプレイしているが、もっと人が増えるに越したことはないのでぜひ遊んでほしい。身の回りでも存在は知ってるし面白そうだけど買ってないという人が多いので、[b] 買え！！！ [/b]



[b] Rock and Stone!!!! Brothers!!!!! [/b]

71371983.review:
Смело могу заявить, что Deep Rock Galactic в моем личном списке сыгранных в 2020 году игр будет иметь особое место, которое можно назвать "открытие года". Внезапно она всплыла в предложке стима и на вид была обычной проходной сессионкой, но что-то заставило меня дать ей шанс. И как же я теперь рад, что решил опробовать ее.

Восторг. Именно так можно описать первые часы в этой игре. Такое замечательное сочетание геймплея и дизайна, мелкие, но приятные механики, вроде танцев и выпивания пива, крайне интересный генератор уровней и великолепный баланс сложности формируют картину целостного и качественного проекта, в который хочется возвращаться каждый день. Стрельба — великолепно! Баланс — отличный! Разнообразие — есть! Поддержка разработчиками проекта — более чем активная! Сообщество — приятное! Что еще нужно для счастья?

Отдельно хочется отметить то, как разработчики ненавязчиво мотивируют игроков к взаимопомощи и поддержке: такие с виду незначительные детали, как вывески с надписью "Дворфов не бросать", объединяющие механики вроде совместного выпивания и дуркования на базе в целом формируют прочную основу для доброжелательного и приятного коммьюнити. Очень порадовало коммьюнити этой игры, отчего даже, когда ты влетаешь на уже идущую сессию к рандомам, и встречая их, ты с радостью прыгаешь к ним в команду, зная, что тебя не бросят, и тебе помогут. И так же ты радуешься каждый раз, когда полутораметровый пьяный дворф влетает к тебе в пачку.

Я серьезно. Берите эту игру как минимум из-за редкого на сегодняшний день сообщества.

Да и как игра про бухущих дворфов-шахтеров на отшибе вселенной может не понравиться?

71153838.review:
Après 2 ans à jouer à Deep Rock de temps en temps (une fois ou deux par semaine, des fois plus, des fois moins), avec 187h de jeu, en tant que vétéran je crois qu'il est temps pour moi de faire un bilan :

- Des mises à jour régulières, avec des apports de contenus variés (nouvelles missions, musiques, compétences, nouveaux types de partie, monstres, équipements,...)
- Une ambiance excellente et même si j'ai perdu la saveur de la découverte après une vingtaine d'heures, elle est tellement géniale que je m'émerveille quand même encore souvent. L'immersion est très bien travaillée, l'interaction entre les joueurs, les musiques, l'environnement, tout est bien foutu et ça s'améliore un peu plus à chaque mise à jour.
- Le gameplay est assez riche et les mécaniques de jeu sont très bien ficelés. Il y a en gros 4 configurations d'armement par classe. Il y a 4 classes, 5 types de missions différents, 9 environnements différents. On a donc 720 parties possibles différentes. Et c'est sans compter les Deep Dive et les Machine Events. Et bien sûr les maps sont procédurales. Bon, après 100h de jeu ça finira toujours par avoir un goût de déjà-vu, ça c'est inévitable, mais ça restera toujours suffisamment varié. Et surtout les mises à jour régulières rajoutent de la variété quand on en manque.
- La progression est très bien, on a toujours un nouvel objectif devant nous. ça peut paraître décourageant au début quand on voit le peu de crédits, d'expérience et de minerais qu'on gagne mais ça augmente vite au fur et à mesure qu'on prend du galon. Simplement en jouant sans trop me focus sur les objectifs et en jouant juste pour le plaisir, ça se fait tranquillement.
- Un univers simple mais cohérent et marrant. On joue un nain, on aime les minerais qui brillent, les barbes, la baston et se pinter la tronche. Et les devs ont eu la bonne idée, - je trouve - de mixer ça avec une organisation du type "grosse entreprise industrielle ultra-hierarchisé qui vise le profit avant tout". Le choix graphique est très bien adapté.

Quelques points qui mériteraient d'être améliorés selon moi :
- ça manque un peu de récompense quand on passe les grades
- ça manque un peu de cosmétiques et il y a quelques incohérences dans les cosmétiques

DRG vaut largement son pesant d'or, je l'ai acheté en solde et si je pouvait je le rachèterai au prix max. C'est la meilleure bonne surprise de jeu "indé" que j'ai jamais eu, et ce sera aussi le plus rentable en terme de temps de jeu par rapport à son coût. Si vous cherchez un jeu pour jouer avec des potes, il est parfait. Et si ça ne branche aucun de vos potes, vous pourrez toujours vous amuser en y jouant seul ou avec des joueurs randoms, mais je doute que ce soit aussi cool (avis perso).

69600077.review:
Je joue à DRG presque depuis les débuts de son existence et j'ai accroché direct !
Un jeu à la fois simple dans le concept (t'es un nain de l'espace et tu dois récolter des minerais et tuer des insectes qui veulent te bouffer) mais le jeu est BEAUCOUP plus riche que ça. Il me faudrait des heures pour vous parler de toutes les fonctionnalités auxquelles vous aurez accès. Allons-y (en résumé) !
- 4 classes jouables. Toutes sont efficaces, chacune à rôle utile à jouer, adaptées (et adaptables) selon votre mode de jeu.
- Adapté aux casuals gamers ET aux hardcore gamers ! Oui madame, si vous ne jouez qu'une ou deux heures par jour vous ne serez pas dégoûtée du jeu !
- Mode online efficace (en plus de 500h de jeu, je n'ai jamais vu les serveurs down). Vous pouvez rejoindre une partie en cours, jouer en mode publique (n'importe qui peut vous rejoindre), jouer en privé (seuls vos amis steam peuvent rejoindre), ou en solo avec un drone pour vous soutenir (un drone très efficace)
- Bosco ! Notre ami à tous, Bosco, le drone qui vous tient compagnie quand vous minez seul. Adorable, travailleur, exterminateur de monstres, il fera ce que vous lui demandez sans jamais se plaindre et vous répondra même si vous le saluez. Bon il refusera de ramasser les fleurs ou les champignons et se contentera de les admirer mais avec tout le travail qu'il fait, on peut lui pardonner d'être romantique ^^
- ÉNORMÉMENT de personnalisations ! Que ça soit votre armure, vos armes, votre apparence, votre pioche ... y'a de quoi faire. Et si on rajoute en plus :
- Les overclocks d'arme ! Après votre première promotion, vous aurez accès aux overclocks d'arme qui peuvent radicalement transformer votre manière de jouer votre classe fétiche. Vous voulez faire des rocket-jump avec un fusil à pompe ? Vous préférez que votre lance-roquette tire des ogive nucléaires ? Déchiqueter les insectes comme une tourelle, immobile mais dévastatrice ? Créer des mur de flammes pour un barbecue ? Oui c'est possible avec [strike]la carte kiwi[/strike] les overclocks.
- L'ambiance ! Musique douce et tranquille dans les moment ... bin doux et tranquilles. Qui devient dynamique dans les phases d'attaques. D'ailleurs, bravo à la team responsable des musiques, elles sont parfaitement adaptées au jeu. Pour vous dire, dans tous mes jeux, une des premières chose que je fais c'est couper la musique, dans DRG : surement pas !
- Les devs ! Oui, c'est assez rare pour être signalé et c'est pour moi le point le plus important. L'équipe de développement est TRES à l'écoute des joueurs,  Je crois que c'est la première fois que je suis hypé à chaque mise-à-jour parce que je sais que ça sera bien. Et je n'ai pas été déçu. Et contrairement à beaucoup de devs qui se contentent de rentabilité, eux jouent aussi (twitch : ghostship_games, généralement le vendredi vers 13h)
- Les types de missions ! Y'a pas que du minage bête et simple. Parfois on vous enverra récolter de la morkite, parfois ça sera une plateforme de minage qu'il faudra alimenter, retrouver une expédition perdue, voler des oeufs d'alien ou éliminer un boss particulièrement coriace. Au moment où j'écris ces lignes, les devs ont annoncé travailler sur de nouveaux types de mission, et j'ai hâte.
- L'ambiance autour du jeu ! Beaucoup d'humour, de fun, de bières, de danses (oui, les nains savent s'amuser aussi !), de fun, de minage, de fun et d'humour !

Coup de coeur perso : le message de Centre de Contrôle chaque fois qu'on fait promouvoir son nain. Motivant, encourageant, un peu nostalgique parfois. Mais à chaque fois, ça me rends fier d'être un nain.

Rock and Stone, mineurs, et à bientôt dans les mines de Hoxxes IV.

69089900.review:
Co-op first-person shooters haven’t had a big impact these days. Left 4 Dead and Left 4 Dead 2 put this style of game on the map by creating exceptional gameplay. Vermintide and Vermintide 2 took it in a somewhat different direction adding character persistence and a little more variety to the combat. Deep Rock Galactic builds on this further by giving you more objectives than simply going from A to B, and the additional mechanics add great depth to this subterranean adventure.

Abbreviated Review: https://youtu.be/5kw7NiaQoNA

[h1]Space Dwarves[/h1]
The premise of how exactly these Space Dwarves came to be on an orbiting station around a planet full of underground resources to mine isn’t explored in the introduction to Deep Rock Galactic. I suppose it’s not particularly important since it’s easy to surmise that it’s just what they do. What’s left is a scenario where your first task is picking one of the Dwarves and getting acquainted with their loadout.

The choice of the Driller, Engineer, Gunner, or Scout is usually a pretty easy one to make once you’re familiarized with them. They have very clearly defined roles. While in every role you’ll be mining resources and collecting items, they each come together to contribute. It’s possible to have duplicate Dwarves in a team (if the host allows it), and you can be successful, but the missing skill set will be noticeable.

The Driller can use his hand drills to quickly create a path between caves and tunnels. The Gunner can shoot zip lines everyone can use to cross gaps and go up and down sheer rock faces easily. Engineers have a platform gun that places mountable platforms on any surface that can be incredibly useful. Then the Scout, while not the most effective class, has the powerful flare gun to create a long-lasting light in the darkness of the depths.

Resources you collect can be used for upgrading their weapons and gadgets independently as well as accessing the massive collection of cosmetics. These unlock with levels gained by the player as well as each Dwarf as you play them. Special minerals mined and cash collected for completing missions are required for all of these purchases.

[h1]The Darkness of the Depths[/h1]
One thing that makes Deep Rock Galactic unique is that the vast majority of the light in the game is generated by the players. There are some bioluminescent flora and fauna as well as some glowing crystals and heated rocks, but never enough to navigate. Each character has a headlamp that provides the bare minimum of a spotlight, but the flares are a requirement in being able to see.

The recharging stockpile of four flares lets you bring light to a small bubble of your surrounding area with what is a fantastic lighting system. The Unreal engine, of course, can take partial responsibility for this, but they’ve done great things with it. The flares recharge slowly enough that, if moving quickly or alone, you will soon be in darkness. This happens quite a bit in the chaos of each mission if you’re not careful, and it’s a great addition.

Being lost in the dark with minimal light knowing that you could easily plunge over a hidden cliff face or wander into a bunch of angry alien bugs is a thrilling, yet terrifying, experience. Making use of the Scout’s flares in wide-open caverns where your light may not reach far becomes very important. Extended battle sections such as boss fights often have your flares burning out mid-fight leaving you clamoring to get them in places to help you see. It adds substance to an otherwise relatively simple combat system.

[h1]Alien Assault[/h1]
The procedural caves of Deep Rock Galactic are filled with minerals and materials to unearth. They’re also home to plenty of hostile plants and creatures. The spider-like monsters are the most common and the majority of them can be killed with the variety of weapons the Dwarves use. Some, however, require a little more finesse to dispatch.

The tougher aliens usually have glowing weak points on which you can focus your fire. You’d think this would make them easy, but they’re often on their back – which is facing away if they’re charging at you. This means team play is even important for fighting. It also makes fighting in the dark more dangerous as some enemies are invisible while others are only partially glowing. Sometimes shooting everything you’ve got in the general direction is the best choice.

Boss fights and especially large aliens can make for really challenging encounters. If you split off to mine some resources by yourself, these guys can ruin your day. Even smaller weaker enemies can swarm the unprepared, but an armored monstrosity cornering you will leave you incapacitated and hoping your team can get to you. This situation can happen even while playing as a team though, as some enemies can grab you can drag you off to far reaches of the map.

[h1]No Dwarf Left Behind[/h1]
Deep Rock Galactic can be played solo, but it’s certainly not the intended experience. Since you can be so easily overwhelmed, you’re given a flying robotic companion with the ability to blast enemies with machine guns and rockets, revive you, and mine minerals high on cave walls for you. It seems useful, but the AI is mediocre at best and the experience is slow and painful by comparison. The game is meant for co-op play and is best experienced that way.

There’s something magical about the combination of combat, resource objectives, and navigating/manipulating the dark tunnels. The procedural construction makes some very natural looking cave designs and the way you can carve through them makes them wonderful to explore. Even with how somewhat repetitious the objectives can be, the diversity in the map design and enemy encounters makes every mission feel unique.

I do hope that the future brings more of everything to the table. More enemies, more mission types, more biomes, maybe even more Dwarf classes. I also wouldn’t mind seeing the Scout get an additional tool to make him more useful. Given that the only thing critical I can think of for this game is that I want more of what is there, I hope I am conveying how much I enjoy it. With the 26 hours I’ve put in it so far, I feel like I’ve only just gotten started. I look forward to diving in more in the future and seeing how high some peoples’ levels are in the game, I’m not the only one with that sentiment.

[quote] If you'd like to see more of my reviews, check out my curator page here: [url= http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28346672-Endyo-Gaming/]Endyo Gaming[/url] and online at BagoGames[/quote]

71447906.review:
Biraz Böcek Ezelim

Helldivers’tan farklı olarak bu sefer kameranın açısını değiştiriyor, birinci şahsa çekiyoruz. Üstelik insan da değiliz. Ne olsak beğenirsiniz, mağaradan mağaraya değerli madenler için koşturan uzay cüceleriyiz! Tabii ki yine türlü böcekleri haşat ettiğimiz, işbirlikçi bilimkurgu nişancı oyunu var önümüzde.


Gelişim sistemi, görev tarzı, rastgele oluşan oyun alanları vesaire Helldivers’la birçok benzerlik taşısa da kendine özgü yapısını oluşturmayı başaran bir iş olmuş. Özellikle değerli kaynakları araştırmayla biraz Minecraft sosu, bunun yanı sıra atmosferi, müzikleri ve detaylı uzay üssüyle kendi özel yerini camiada tayin ediyor.

Bu oyun tarzı ilginç ve keyifli olduğu kadar da tehlikeli. Özellikle zayıf yapılırsa oyuncuyu daha ilk birkaç saatte sıkabilir. Çünkü tekrara düşme riskini de yanında taşıyor. Ancak hem değişken mağaralarla oynanış çeşitleniyor ve heyecan korunuyor hem de gelişim sistemiyle yeni unsurlar keşfetmeye ve bunları kullanmaya yönelik merak sıkılmadan oynamanıza vesile oluyor.

Kim Olmak İstersin?
Deep Rock Galactic’te işbirlikçi oynanışın Helldivers‘a göre bir adım öteye taşındığını söylemem gerekli. İzci, topçu, mühendis ve delici (bu benim) olmak üzere 4 sınıftan birini seçebiliyorsunuz. Tabii istediğiniz zaman, oyun stilinize yahut görevinize göre farklı sınıflarla oynayabilir veya takım arkadaşlarınızla çeşitli kombinasyonlar yapabiliriniz. Hepsi ince detayları düşünülerek oluşturulmuş sınıflar bunlar.

Ayrıca mağaralarda çevre tamamen yok edilebilir olarak tasarlanmış. Bu hem tehlikelere gebe hem de oldukça keyifli bir oynanış sunuyor. Gitmek istediğiniz bir bölgeyi kazarak kendi yolunuzu açabilir, birden kendinizi yere çakılırken bulabilirsiniz (sık sık düştüğüm için takım arkadaşlarımdan tekrar özür diliyorum…). Hâlihazırda harita sistemi de sizi oldukça zorluyor. Yani kaybolmanız, “Neredeyim ben?” sorularıyla boğuşmanız da olası. Bu sebeple kendi yolunuzu oluşturmak ve haritanın zorlu takibi özel önem taşıyor.

Bira İçelim, Dans Edelim?
Yani… çünkü zorlu görevimizden önce birlikte bira tokuşturmalı dwarf geleneğimizi atlarsak ayıp etmiş oluruz. Göreve sarhoş gitmek tehlikeli mi (gerçekten sarhoş oluyoruz), kimin umurunda?

Oyunda içtikten sonra bayılma, küçülme gibi farklı etkilere sahip farklı bira tarifleri mevcut. Aynı zamanda uzay üssünüzde müzik dinleyip dans edebileceğiniz, basket oynayabileceğiniz, anma salonunda gezebileceğiniz mekânlar var. Bunlar gibi ince detayların düşünülmüş olması gerçekten harika. Uzay üssünü yaşayan bir yere dönüştürüyor, takımımızın toplanma ve görevler arasında takılması için harika bir alan ortaya çıkıyor.

Deep Rock Galactic’te olumsuz eleştirebileceğim gerçekten az unsur var. Bunların birçoğu da oyun sonu istatistikleri gibi geliştirilebilecek küçük detaylar. Oyundaki yaratık çeşitliliği de artırılabilirse hoş olur. Hâlihazırda oturmuş ve gelişime açık bir yapım olması asıl önemli olan. Gerisi zamana kalıyor. Geliştirici ekibin erken erişimi ne kadar iyi geçirdiği ve gelecekte de planladıklarının bolluğu, umutla bakmaya sebep oluyor. Zaten aklımdaki birçok olumsuz eleştirinin cevabını da yayınladıkları zengin yol haritasında buldum. Gayet farkındalar ne eksik, ne eklenmeli.

Son Olarak
Uzay üssünde içilen biradan karakter tasarımına kadar birçok detaya önem verilmiş bir oyun Deep Rock Galactic. Akıcı aksiyonu, taktiksel işbirlikçi yapısı, genel olarak yaratıcı tasarımı, müzikleri, estetik tarzı, atmosferi, müzikleri… Övmeye değer o kadar çok iyi özelliği var ki!

Steam’de 50 TL gibi bir ücrete sahip ve bunu son kuruşuna kadar hak ettiğini söyleyebilirim. Eğer oyun yapısı hoşunuza giderse uzun saatler boyunca bireysel yahut takımla keyifle vakit geçirebileceğiniz bir oyun vadediyor. Ayrıca oyunun Türkçe dil seçeneği olduğunu da belirtmeden geçmeyeyim.

Görevlere sarhoş gitmeyin! (Cem Altınışık) Benim gibi…

69110059.review:
[h1]The Best PvE co-op game right now![/h1]

  This game has a lot to offer, from beer, dwarves, alien insects to awesome beards for customizing your badass dwarf. I first stumbled upon this game around Update 8 or 9 and I thought to myself "hmm, this game looks like lots of fun". I managed to buy it a little later, around Update 16 or 17. Anyway, I was astonished by this game from the first mission. At some moments it feels a little repetitive, but that's mostly because you're playing alone. I decided to nag some friends into buying it and the game showed it's true potential (just to clarify, the game is tons of fun when you play it solo too, but I can see how it could get a little boring for some people).
  Playing this game with friends is easily the best recipe for almost endless hours of fun! The game has 4 classes and a party would consist of 4 people at most. Each character is unique in it's own way. 
[list]
[*][b]The Driller[/b] is a class which has a flamethrower, a small caliber pistol, 2 drill arms to go through dirt and stone like it's butter and some c4, because blowing stuff up is fun!
[*][b]The Gunner[/b] is a class based on mowing shit down as fast as possible and he's equiped with mean lean killing machine of a gatling gun, basically a deagle (for them cool one digs), a zipline gun used for shooting ziplines across the cave for mobility and a shield generator to help yourself and/or your teammates when they're overwhelmed by enemies.
[*][b]The Enginear[/b] is a pretty balanced class when it comes to the arsenal and mobility (in my opinion), he is equiped with a shotgun, a granade launcher, a platform gun that shoots platforms on any surface and it's very useful to climb walls and cross gaps and his last piece of equipment is a sentry gun that's great for protection and for defending different spots.
[*][b]The Scout[/b] is the class with the highest mobility and survivability (again, in my opinion) and his equipment consists of an SMG, a double barrel shotgun, a zipline gun that could be used to yeet himslef and himself only around the cave and flare gun which shoots big flares that lighten up a big area and it's great for the moments when you are getting swarmed.
[/list]
Lastly, I have to add that the things mentioned about the classes, it's just a portion of what the game offers. There are also new guns you get as you progress through the game, upgrades for your weapons, different types of throwable grenades, perks that you can unlock and combine them for different play styles, beer, a shop to customize your character and more beer. 
All in all, I give this game a solid 9/10. The only thing that I would consider a con, would be some performance issues and not enough beer.

70142712.review:
<--- Nach 46 Stunden ---->
Immer noch ein wahnsinnig geiler, motivierender Scheiß! Etwas präziser:
+ Es gibt immer etwas Neues zu entdecken (z. B. Cubes, Loot Boxes, Level Up, Deep Dive, Overclocking).
+ Es ist immer abwechslungsreich (z. B. verschiedene Mitspieler/innen, Auftragstypen, Klassen, Waffenmodifikationen, Cosmetics)
+ Der Mineralienabbau ist wirklich befriedigend. Wenn man mit der Hacke in die satte Nitra- oder Goldader schlägt, gibt das ein ziemlich gutes Gefühl!
- Manche Mitspieler/innen sind manchmal irgendwie nicht in der Lage zu kommunizieren. Und damit meine ich in den Chat zu schreiben, ob das Abschließen der Mission auch für alle okay ist. Ein einfaches "rdy" würde da genügen.

Ich finde das Spiel besser als so manchen Triple-A-Titel! Zu oft passiert es mir, dass ich nur 1-2 Aufträge spielen will, woraus dann aber doch einige Stunden werden ;)


<--- Nach den ersten Stunden --->
Was für ein geiler Scheiß! Das Spiel macht eine Menge Spaß!

Es ist absolut befriedigend mit einem Flammenwerfer eine Horde herannahender Spinnen nieder zu brennen oder mit einer Chaingun in eben dieselbe Horde "reinzuhalten"! Dass Aufleveln, auf dem das Spiel basiert, macht wirklich Laune und ist daher sehr motivierend.

Unvergessen geil sind für mich vor allem diese beiden Spielmomente, in denen ein Boss-Gegner, den wir getötet haben, mit seinem Ableben derart heftig explodiert ist, dass er in die enge Höhle ein ziemlich großes Loch gesprengt hat. So eine Levelzerstörung ist mir als durchschnittlichem Gamer in den letzten Jahren nicht untergekommen.
Der andere Moment war der, in denen ein "Schwarm", also eine Horde an unterschiedlichen Gegnern, auf uns zukam. Wir befanden uns in einem nach unten führenden Tunnelabschnitt, der pechschwarz war. Ich habe noch eine Flare hinein geworfen, die etwas Licht gespendet hat, aber nach einer Zeit ja auch ausgeht. Als dann die Gegnermassen aus der totalen Finsternis auf uns zu kamen, und ich mit dem Flammenwerfer in den Tunnel gefeuert habe, kam ein ziemliches "Alien"-Gefühl (also bezogen auf die Filme bzw auf den ersten "Alien vs. Predator"-Computerspiel) auf. Das war schon ziemlich geil.

Ob sich das Spiel in den nächsten Stunden auch noch so frisch halten wird, wird sich zeigen. Aufgrund der ausgewählten folgenden Aspekte denke ich aber, dass das Spiel für bestimmt noch mindestens 20 Stunden spannend und motivierend bleibt:

+ Die verschiedenen Missionsdesigns (bisher vier verschiedene und nach wie vor fordernde, spannende Missionstypen - laut meinem Kenntnisstand sollen mit dem nächsten Update noch zwei weitere folgen; das Spiel bekommt also auch nach wie vor zusätzlichen Content(+!)),
+ Die vielen verschiedenen Missionen, die für einen verfügbar sind,
+ Die variablen Schwierigkeitsgrade für die Missionen, die man immer selber einstellen kann,
+ Die vielen Spielewelten, die vom "Biotop" her immer anders sind, die sich aber auch vom Level- bzw. Höhlendesign her bisher nie gleichen,
+ Wenn der Höhlenkomplex am Ende des Spiels unter Zeitdruck verlassen werden muss, und man dabei auf Wellen von Gegnern trifft bzw. von ihnen verfolgt wird, kommt gerade in den ersten Stunden des Spiels sehr viel Spannung auf (z. B. wenn das das M.U.L.E. einfach mal mitten in der Decke verschwindet und man mit der gewählten Klasse noch nicht so ganz raus hat, wie man vertikal flüchten kann), später entwickelt man dafür aber geeignete Strategien, der "Levelausgang" bleibt aber nach wie vor spannend,
+ Ein toller Coop-Modus (der mit fremden Mitspielern bisher so gut wie zu 100% immer gut geklappt hat), der so leicht zugänglich ist (Spiel hosten oder einem der eigentlich immer verfügbaren bereits offenen Spiele beitreten),
+ Die abgebaute Mineralien, die man am Ende der Mission mit nachhause nehmen kann/will (samt XP),
+ Das Upgraden der vier verschiedenen Klassen, in das man viel Zeit stecken kann,
+ Die nacheinander freispielbaren Cosmetics (echt super!),
+ Die Raumstation, auf der man bestimmte Missions- und Upgrademöglichkeiten noch mit einem wesentlich höheren Charakterlevel freispielen kann, etc.

Negativ könnte man bewerten, dass man sich in die Spielmechaniken über Tutorials (YouTube), dem umfangreichen(+!) Wiki bzw. dem umfangreichen(+!) HUD innerhalb des Spiels einarbeiten muss. Die ein oder andere Menuführung (z. B. bei den Perks) ist etwas unübersichtlich und vom Design her nicht so ansehnlich gestaltet, aber das ist an sich nicht großartig schlimm.

Fazit: Das Spiel ist ein endloser Grind, der aufgrund der oben genannten Aspekte aber 10/10 Spielspaß bedeutet :-D Außer den "Hackereien" im Erdreich hat das Spiel mit Minecraft nicht zu tun. In Tests habe ich den leichten Vergleich schon häufiger gelesen/gehört.
Es ist ein absolut nettes und mit jeder Mission immer wieder auch ein neues Abenteuer. Ein Abenteuer mit Zwergen(!), die zwergentypisch echt gut aussehen, und die ordentlich rumballern! Ein super Crossover zwischen Fantasy und Sci-Fi! 
Ich kann das Spiel jeder/jedem empfehlen, die/der bis hierhin gelesen hat und sich von der Darstellung angesprochen fühlt, denn genauso ist das Spiel in meinen Augen auch in echt :-)

"Rock and Stone!"

69295410.review:
Deep Rock Galactic is a fantastically designed game with great solo and group play. Matchmaking is quick and easy, drop in and drop out. The progression is solid, customization is great, challenge can be chosen from easy breezy to brutally savage. One of my favorite elements is all the subtlety and nuance - here are mini-games, a wide beer selection with bizarre effects, tons of cosmetics, all kinds of hilarious interactables, hidden quests and rooms. Combat feels active and engaging, especially with the huge variation across all the weapons and classes.

There's a ton of longevity and replayability. On the surface, I think a lot of people can see it and think it'll feel repetitive. But with the diversity of missions and biomes, variety of builds and combos with classes and their gear (especially when you unlock new weapons and overclocks), weekly fresh missions and quests for the endgame content, and more. I can assure you, once you dive into the game you'll feel deeply compelled to dive deeper every time.

And one of the most important things, you know this game is gonna have a lot more content over time and plenty of support, since this game has a brilliant track record in early access through to the full release.

For rock and stone!

I like it, although I could complain about the lack of competition in game. I often don't know how I can improve myself since the metrics are meaningless and once you can perform your class "good enough", you should be able to play the hardest difficult. Each class has a max lvl of 25, then you can unlock more upgrades and game systems which can make you even stronger, however most of my classes are below 20 and I am already able to play Hazard 5, the top difficult.

I would love something harder, but the way the game works... well, it will require a lot of thinking in order to make it harder while not making the enemies simply bullet sponges.

I would like to compare this game to Vermintide 1 and 2. I actually find it more satisfying because there you can recognize when you are getting better at the game, you can do things others can't do (the better you play and acumulate experience).

71756269.review:
Un joc promitator si o gura de aer proaspat pentru fanii genului co-op vs horde multiplayer(de exemplu Vermintide).

Poveste: specific acestui gen de joc povestea este simpla... *spoiler* intr-un univers futurist dwarfii au cucerit stelele si se ocupa cu mineritul corpurilor ceresti(asteroizi, planete etc) sub numele unei companii galactice. Mai mult de atat nu este precizat si nu este nevoie... scopul e sa faci cat mai multe misiuni si sa te imbogatesti.

Gameplay: Inainte de fiecare misiune iti pregatesti personajul pe care il poti alege din 4 clase (driller, gunner, scout si engineer), il echipezi atat utilitar (arme, scut de energie, grenade ) cat si cosmetic(palarii, armuri,diverse culori si sortimente precum si interactiuni emote). Apoi iti alegi tipul de misiune *spoiler* minat minerale si metale pretioase, recuperare echipamente, vanatoare de insecte intergalactice si ouale lor. Sunt cateva tipuri de mediu mai putin(mina de cristal, padure subterana) sau mai mult(caverna de lava, mina fara oxigen, padurea cu paraziti) periculoase. Aici o surpriza  placuta si un mare plus: hartile sunt generate aleator si totul poate fi minat si sau distrus fie folosind armele si explozibile , fie tarnacopul disponibil tuturor claselor. Mai este de precizat ca daca doresti sa joci solo, poti aduce cu tine un robotel utilitar foarte folositor in minat, atacat si ca detector de inamici avand si el anumite abilitati(rachete). Robotelul este printre cele mai utile npc-uri pe care le poti avea intr-un joc (este invulnerabil si este imposibil sa te blocheze in vreun fel). Dificultatea se seteaza specific acestui tip de joc si poate deveni foarte dificila. Inamicii sunt in general insecte extraterestre hiperdimensionate, nu foarte originale dar destul de diverse.

Aspect si grafica: este unul placut, aparent simplist, spre animat, necesar tinand cont ca se poate interactiona cu absolut orice iar mediile sunt pe diverite niveluri de adancime, efectele de mediu sunt foarte atractive si destul de unice fiecarui tip de regiune (unele nu au oxigen, altele au paraziti,  furtuni,  cristale electrice, ciuperci criogenizante explozive etc).

In concluzie Deep Rock este un joc in care se vede dedicarea si dragostea developerilor fata de munca lor. Ofera un nivel mare de rejucabilitate, ceea ce este foarte binevenit pentru aceste jocuri care deobicei devin rutina, plictisitoare, repetitive, insa acest joc te poate tine distrat iar si iar explorand medii creative generate aleator. In viitor este bine sa fii pitic :)

72310357.review:
개발사와의 소통이 원활하고 패치 후 핫픽스도 빠르게 해준다.
또, 얼액때부터 꾸준하게 로드맵대로 패치를 해왔고 추가된 것도 많다.

칭찬할 것도 많지만 그렇게 좋다고는 하지 못할 점도 많다.

우선 컨텐츠가 적다.
얼액때부터 지금까지 추가된건 딥다이브와 무기 개조 부품, 각종 치장 아이템 파밍이다.
딥다이브는 개조 부품이나 치장 아이템을 보상으로 주는데 있어도 그만 없어도 그만이다.
개조 부품이 많다고 해서 색다른 빌드를 창출하느냐하면 그건 또 아니기 때문이다.
치장 아이템은 곡괭이나 캐릭터를 꾸미거나 무기 스킨인데 디자인이 그렇게 좋진 않다. 차라리 통합 레벨을 올리면 주는 퀘스트로 얻는 보상들이 더 멋지고 가치 있어 보인다.

적들의 종류가 다양하지 않다.
요즘 패치를 보면 종류를 추가하는 패치를 하긴 하는데 그래도 필자가 처음 이 게임을 시작했을때보다 3개 정도 밖에 추가 되지 않았다.
때문에 게임을 오래하다보면 방사능 지형, 빙하 지형, 늪지대 지형, 용암 지형에 따른 속성만 바뀔 뿐 적들의 다양성은 적다.

이 게임의 본질은 노가다인데 오래하면 질린다.
유저들과 x키 v키로 가슴이 웅장해지는 대화도 결국엔 질리게 되어있다.
개조 부품 제작도 치장템 제작도 모두 자원과 돈으로 제작한다. 맥주도 3가지는 소량의 돈으로 마실 수 있지만 언락하고 제작하는 건 맵을 돌다가 얻는 열매들로 제작할 수 있다.
각잡고 해야하는 노가다는 아니여서 그냥 돌다보면 언젠가는 쌓여 남아돌긴 한다만 쌓여 있을때 쯤이면 질려서 게임을 안하게 된다.

맵, 미션의 종류가 적다.
맵과 미션의 경우 추가된 것은 없다.
승진 한번 하고나면 할 수 있는 미션이 몇개 있지만 그건 그냥 미니 게임 수준이여서 미션이라고 하긴 애매하다.

위에 쓴 것들을 보면 굳이 게임을 사서 할 이유가 없다. 하지만 키 두개만으로 국적 불문하고 가슴이 웅장해지는 소통을 할 수 있는 게임은 찾기 힘들고
아무리 질린다고 해도 80시간 정도는 재밌게 할 수 있는 게임인 것을 감안하면 충분히 가격 값 한다고 볼 수 있다.

I really wanted to like this game, but so far it's been nothing but annoying. Too disorienting for my taste. If you're also colorblind, good luck with that. 
It takes quite some time to fill the fetch quests for a mission, so no quickies here. And after an hour or so of play, when you've filled your mule with the fetch loot, it takes off to the landing pod. If you're not able to follow it quick enough, tough luck, your pod takes off without you. All your work for nothing. 
I would have enjoyed it more if my majority of playtime was spent on gathering loot and defending myself, but most of your time is spent on finding the required loot, so not much action there.

73999658.review:
This game gets by on featuring dwarves in space.
On the tin it looks great. It has destructible terrain, exploration, the afore mentioned space-dwarves, and it's multiplayer. It should be the perfect "saturday night gaming with friends and beer" -game, but it isn't.

The gameplay is shallow and repetitive. The unlocks are boring. The classes feel to similar in that they can all accomplish the same in marginally different ways, and the enemies are both boring to look at and trivial to defeat, resulting in one-dimensional combat encounters. For all the polish and what the potentially great game universe theoretically has to offer, it fails to deliver anything that hasn't been delivered a million times before with more depth and / or entertainment.

The game isn't bad, it's just boring. As of writing this a friend of mine summarized the game perfectly: "I don't understand why this game has such a high rating. It does nothing that Borderlands 2 from ages ago doesn't do a million times better."

To top it off, it's expensive. Consider buying at 75% off. Buying it at its current price is a mistake.

96% positive reviews gives rise to conspiracy theories. This is a 5/10 at the very best.

73981637.review: My favorite game at the moment. The game itself is beyond amazing and the community is really friendly. (Always had fun with the random miners I've joined/joined me.) I highly recommend this game.

73975390.review:
Everyone who prefers coop instead of pvp should give this game a try.
Possibly one of the nicest gaming communities out there with very kind people all around. Don't be afraid of asking something mid-game, since - in my experience - people will be happy to help you.

If you like to be able to customize your characters and weapons in terms of performance and looks, look no further. This game allows you to not only change the skins of your weapons, but also the overall appearance of it. Meaning, you can have a normal pistol look like you custome engineered it at home AND change its skin seperatly. 
Also, performance upgrades are easy to understand and provide a lot of different ways to play with no special meta you have to follow in order to succeed at the game. And even though you unlock new grenades and wepaons, your starting ones are still very viable options. Instead of following a system, where new weapons are simply better than the old ones, this game follows a system where new weapons are just different in how the play and function, therefore creating different playstyles that are all viable.

73969679.review:
This game is freaking fantastic. It has beer brewing, beard, armor, pickaxe and weapon customization, cosmetics come from in-game challenges and the prestige / promotion mechanic keeps your motivation always high. The four classes have levels of synergy that make it hard to think a fifth class that would fit in here and the playstyle vary from high-precision to in-your-face shotgun style to AoE and DoT. In over 100 hours I was not bored once because the procedurally generated caves always (and I mean ALWAYS) give you a new set of challenges for every mission that require multiple classes to overcome. If you're solo you will be accompanied by a drone that fights and mines with you. I bought it for 20 bucks but a few days ago i bought every DLC they have just to support this amazing game.

Bonus points: The community is amazing and helpful to newbies and I have  encountered toxic players only once or twice.

ROCK AND STONE!

Everything has loads of character, and the crass humor works a lot better than you'd expect - I can appreciate a game that automatically insults your teammates over friendly fire. Just a little warning, though: one of the worst communities I ever had the displeasure of interacting with, a mix of resentful, entitled early access old timers, moderators on a power trip, and a large amount of shills who will try to gaslight you into thinking it's the best community ever, [i]or else[/i].

This game is going to be just like the first Killing Floor. You're going to buy it. And you're going to have a blast, so you're going to tell your friends to buy it. They're going to have a blast. You're all going to be having a blast together. 

After a month or two, like any game, interest will start to wane, so you'll move on to other things. Then there will be a lull in things you want to do.

And one day you're friend will be all like,
-"What do you wanna do?"
-"Beats me? Wanna play some Deep Rock?"
-"Sure."

And the interest is booted back up.

Not joking, it is a fantastic game and I really hope the devs continue to expand on game modes, world building; just anything and everything. All I know is, I want more Deep Rock Galactic.

73928808.review:
A very fun game! Both by yourself and when in a team. There are definitely times when I felt that playing alone is "better" in a way that you have Bosco and that you can easily order him to mine some minerals and ores and attack enemies to protect your lonely a*s deep underground. Of course, these tasks are not much of a problem if you're playing in a team. And this is where it gets really fun and creative.

Depending on the combination of dwarves in a team, the game can get really interesting. Like how a Scout can carelessly try to grab an alien fossil from the ceiling and not break his legs, thanks to the Engineer's platforms. Otherwise, I can't really imagine him not dancing to the beat on the Space Rig after a couple of rounds.

I love how not one of the dwarves is overpowered. It almost always happens to me where I go "Hmm. This Gunner is almost perfect. Now... if ONLY I got the Scout's flare gun, the Driller's power drill and the Engineer's secondary weapon (Breach Cutter)". But hey, reality is that... you don't have them. Better stick to the team and don't go too far on your own. After all, what could be worse than being caught by a cave leech with no one around to save you.
